content:
Posted: May 13, 2015
Early Access Review
								FOR THE DEVS:The game needs several improvements to make it more playable:-A better inventory system. For instance we should be able to put a gun in our inventory. We should also be able to remove clothes by hand-The needs system needs to improved. For instance my character is on the verge of dying every 5 minutes. Be it dehydration or starvation, it should be less unforgiving.-It would be nice to have servers for english speaking players and for russian players. Till now I've only met 2 english players. Since I don't speak russian it's hard for me to communicate with the other survivors.-Add actual character customization. Don't tell me it's a feature when it isn't even in the game.-It would be nice to have my fist as a weapon.-A global chat function would be nice. Some people don't own mics.-And please hire an actual native english speaking employee. Google translate items are tedious.The game is actually fun and I enjoy it. Keep up the good work.These are just my two cents. Please like so the devs can see.

Early Access Review
								The recent push to beta ruined the game.You used to be able to roam the snow covered russian land scape, looking for supplies to survive and hoping to find fuel so you can light a log and stay warm for the night.Not, its a faux spring time texture set right over the old one, with the same sound effects. This is visually appaling, and combined with the horrible layout of the new maps, it is just disgusting. On top of all of this, the number of servers and players has decreased dramatically. At any given time, there are only 3 servers online, each with 5 people or less on it. This is because now they made strictly russian servers, and strictly english, and one other language. This was a horrible move by developers, and this ruined their american player base. It also removed a fun element from the gameThis game went from a solid 4/5 to, at best, a 2/5. The devs should roll back to the aplha version and fix the bugs, and make an anti-cheat that doesnt run on a potato curcuit.

number of helpful: 229 of 240 people (95%) found this review helpful15 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								Firstly, I would like to point out that the follow points are constructively criticising the game in order to get it out of that early alpha stage. NOTE: This game doesn't have zombies in it, so if you are buying it hoping for that then you're out of luckThe good points:• Considering how new the game is, the gun play is extremely 'solid' for lack of a better phrase to describe how smooth it can feel.• The game is very well optimized, I run it at 1080p on a GTX 750 Ti paired with an i7 4790 to remove bottlenecking and I receive a solid 60 fps on maximum settings without any FPS lag whatsoever.• There is a nice amount of guns already, it has overtaken the DayZ Standalone given the amount of time the developers have put into it and I have a feeling that it will grow exponentially as soon as big Youtubers hear about it and start to play it.• The map is quite a nice size, you will have to run for a while to reach the end of the map. Whether you recieve better gear or not is really dependant on your luck.• The weather is a very nice side feature as well as a *NON-BUGGY* (I can't stress that enough when compared to DayZ) eating, and heat system.• The servers are stable enough and easy to set up and ones which you join aren't too laggy depending on your connection. (The combat sometimes get's slightly laggy, but hey ho)The Bad Points:• The only AI Enemies in the game are dogs, this by itself is fine, but there is definitely a problem with them. They spawn in packs in certain areas such as the military base and many other places far away from the generic new player spawn (very South of the map). Usually, this would feel nice and challenging but the problem generates when no loot is actually spawned at the military base apart from an odd M1911 magazine with 4 bullets in it. Whoopee.. This can be tested by creating a fresh server with brand new shiny loot (Dare I say), and you will see that there are too many dogs considering the lack of good loot. To improve, reverse their spawns and make them spawn in the wild and not near what was once human civilisation to encourage players not to wander off.• The melee combat is for one, dubious. It seems that the hit boxes on enemies and dogs in particular are very tiny, and in order for you to deal some damage, you need to be within licking range, fair enough for man to man combat, but when it comes to dogs, it's a big no no when you think about how many you will have to kill.• The heat system is too unforgiving. Staying inside with a jacket on still lowers your temperature, and once it gets to roughly 25 degress ᶜᶦᵗᵃᵗᶦᵒᶰ ᶰᵉᵉᵈᵉᵈ your health starts to slowly decrease. The second part I don't have a problem with, but the only way to get your temperature is to create a fire which requires an axe to get firewood, lighter fluid (I think?) and a lighter. The chance of finding everything for that is pretty slim• Similar to the heat system, the health system is VERY unforgiving. Running into dogs and surviving will probably take your health down the the 'Wounded' or 'Severely Wounded' stage. The only way to get your health back up is to take medicine of some description which is recognised by a generic 'Bottle o' Peels' and those pills are.. Yes you guessed it.. Extremely Rare. To improve this, they should allow your health to regenerate slowly as long as your other basic needs are satisfied.• There isn't a full tutorial for noobs who have no clue what they're doing. Some people who have played a lot of survival games take to it very quickly, but they will soon come to a halt somewhere. For instance, the weapon reloading system in itself is quite complicated at first, but you can get the hang of it. What annoyed me is how some of the guns were in Russian meaning you couldn't understand what they were called and look up their calibre on Wikipedia. Adjacent to the name of the gun, the type of ammo should be displayed so you know exactly what ammo to look out for.• One teeny tiny point is that my guns seem to not fire exactly when I need them to, and ammo doesn't seem to stack very effectively sometimes. This is more of a minor bug than a problem.• When you die, sometimes there will be a spectator mode in which you can see everyone meaning if you know one area well, you can track them down if you're lucky enough. Fair enough if you're on other side of the map, but if you're in the spawn then it can become a problem rather quickly. No neeed to explain that one ;-)• The final point isn't too much of a problem, but the servers seem to sort depending on how many people are actually in them, meaning you can't join a game that your friend has created if it's just them in it. And no, there's no option to join via Steam. This isn't much of a problem but sometimes it's nicer just to have a game with your friends are gear up before venturing into the big, bandity world.EDITS:• The guns don't fire because they either 'need oil' or 'need repair' (or broken if heavily used but not maintained) These are all of the points I have collected so far, and don't be discouraged by the sheer amount of negative comments I have hopefully successfully conveyed. There are far many more good points such as atmosphere and looting system that I could've writtne about, but they're so small individually that they aren't worth it, they do however create a massive difference when put together in an online game.Overall I definitely recommend this to people who enjoy survival games and are looking to support the developers in order for them to improve this already outstanding game. Dean 'Rocket' Hall can shove that so called effort he has been putting into the DayZ mod up his buttocks and salute these developers who are much closer to the community.If you wish to ask me any questions about the game, feel free to message me on Steam, I'm not the most experienced person but i'll try my best to answer any questions-Jacob :)

number of helpful: 247 of 296 people (83%) found this review helpful19 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 8, 2015
Early Access Review
								     This game does have potential, especially at this price, however a few major issues are holding this game back.  First of which is the dehydration mechanic.  For the rarity of finding water the dehydration bar drains much too fast.  It either needs to drain slower or more water/juice/soup needs to be spawned in the game.  The second major problem is the wolves.  Often times I spawn in looking for loot in a building only for a wolf to run in and start attacking me.  If I don't have a weapon there isn't much I can do to defend myself as the character runs out of stamina too quickly and the wolf can easily kill you.  Also the wolves can find you much too easily often I'll be on the second floor of a building and wolves will come from miles away outside, run into the building, climb up the stairs and run into my room.  Again if I haven't found a weapon by that point suicide is the best option because I have no way of getting away.  Also the hit detection seems pretty off, many times I've been in a firefight with someone and shoot them multiple times at close range with a shotgun only for them to switch to an axe and hit me once or twice with it and kill me.  Overall this game is solid for the price.  I have had many fun moments in intense firefights; frantically trying to loot the bodies of the players I has just slain.  Unfortunately these moments are too far and few inbetween and some of the mechanics are so game breaking that I cannot recommend this game until they are addressed.

Early Access Review
								The game is completely worth 5$The graphics look amazing, and it runs so smoothly.If you're into DayZ, but don't have the money or the best computer, you should definitely give this game a try.Pros:-Graphics are really good-Runs smoothly on almost any computer-A lot of people don't KoS (Kill on Sight)-Just came out, so they're adding new things every day.-It's fun to create buildings with the crafting systemCons:-There aren't options where you can change mouse sensitivity, -Just came out, and not a lot of people are playing it.-Animations can be a little weird (Which makes the game fun sometimes)-You can spectate other players after death, which can cause people to learn where people are, which ruins the survival feeling,Edit: The dev's have pretty much gave up on this game, so there's barely any updates, and about no one plays it any more. It sucks because I really enjoyed this game and wanted to watch it grow to be something bigger. Right now I probably wouldn't buy it if you want something  that will last a long time.

content:
Posted: November 11, 2015
Early Access Review
								Really dissapointing. Played just over 6 hours I think, and Im calling it a day. In those hours, I played on the busiest servers, about 8-9 players, and I only ever met one person.  We stood opposite each other, at around 20ft distance, unloaded our guns on each other, and neither of us took any hits!?  I have shot many a charging wolf before you say it is my aim :PThe wolves are a relentless pain, and sometimes you will be spawned next to some, which means you have to run and hope for the best, as you have no ability to punch or kick these hungry little cretins.  Loot is scarce, you'll find yourself sprinting from building to building, searching endless empty cupboards and drawers, before you starve or dehydrate. If your lucky enough to find these resources, you'll probably freeze to death, as this is another element to contend with, and being fully clothed in winter gear and standing in a house is apparently not enough.  Theres loads of bugs, screen goes black whilst the sound continues, getting stuck in floors etc, but I expected these to be fair.  If this game was free, it might be worth a couple of hours of your time, if you have the patience of a saint.  As it currently stands, Id say keep your cash.

content:
Posted: August 30, 2015
Early Access Review
								As much as I really hate to say it I cannot reccomend this game, at the moment. When I first picked this up it was pretty damn good, needed a lot of work but it was good, WAS. The recent transition into "Beta" had royally buggered this game. The map is too empty. I spawned at a petrol station and spend over 10 minutes walking along a straight road and found nothing. After I suicided I found a "TT" pistol, it took 1911 mags, I found some ammo and another empty mag and tried to load it, nada. I then unloaded the mag that I had in my gun to find it had .357 ammo, went to put it back into the clip, nada. I then had no usable ammo. I went to explore after this point and found that the "Jumping" sound effect was so much louder than the others that I nearly fell off my chair in fright. The effect of running on grass makes your character sound like he's running over shrapnel or bullet casing.TL;DR - The recent "update" has totally ♥♥♥♥ed the game, if I'd written this a few months ago it would have been a totally different review. With that in mind: keep an eye on this game if interested. The Devs have taken some wrong turns BUT the game WAS good so there's no reason it can't be good again, given time and a new approach to "updates".

content:
Posted: January 19, 2016
Early Access Review
								PLEASE Don't pay any attention to reviews from players with not even 1 hour of play time.. They most likely died because they are♥♥♥♥♥♥and didn't know what to do.. SURPRISE SURPRISE!! This game is actually decent. Just earlier I was running around one of the towns and got gunned down.. When I respawned, I was lucky enough to find an old rifle and some ammo close by and walked back to the person looting my gear. I lined him up and BOOM HEADSHOT. Took all of my stuff back and most of his aswell.. It was very intense.. This game has created a very real world feel. There is no chat, which I think is AWESOME. Means you don't get any spam or ♥♥♥♥♥es having a good cry.. There is voice chat for when you are close to someone or if you have a walkie talkie you can talk to anyone in the same town as you..There are only 2 bad things about this game:1. There aren't enough players yet to be able to always play against people, sometimes you feel like you are playing solo game..2. Limited content and small bugs, but hey... It's early alpha, what do you expect? And it's $5.. C'mon.All in all, it's a fun game and well worth your $5. Give it a good chance, play it for a couple hours, look up some guides if you get stuck. If there was more people giving it a chance then it would be such a fun game for everyone to play!

Early Access Review
								This game gave me trust issues.>spawn in a field near a cabin>walk into the lovely abode to find a dead body and a half naked man with an axe>Make eye contact with the axeman>He laugh maniacally and while saying something in Russian then runs>I blink loot the cabin retrieving penicillin and more food then Charles Barkley could eat>chill in the cabin until the storm subsides>walk out to see three armed men>I dip>in mid sprint one yells "Wait Stop we need another crew mate">I stop and turn>He then walks in front of me. "Need supplies? well here... TAKE SOME LEAD A**hole!" Then shoots me in the face.After a few hours in and many deaths, I learned trust no one.  I spent 15 real life minutes pointing a pistol with 3 bullets at a door anticipating a man who was promising me he was friendly, that man passed away before I could tell.  This game changed me, i've become a different person.  A monster.  I dumped my girlfriend because a message from a guy named Dad was on her phone.  I don't sleep... I simply perch up in a corner anticipating the inevitable wolf or scavenger breaking into my looting place.  I don't leave my home either, because I don't want to leave my shelter undefended.  Thanks alot Survival: Postapocalypse Now.11/10- Would take some more lead and not trust anyone ever again again.

content:
Posted: May 26, 2015
Early Access Review
								Me & my friend bought the game for the fun of it, and since it was 5 Euro we did, we thought it wouldn't be that good and kinda slagged it, but man this game is fun,exciting and pure  PvP. As soon as me and my friends load up we both started looting and met up very fast, in fact it is really easy to find friends because from what I notice you spawn close to each other at the start. But after that you can then make your way into the wild ^_^.      When I got on I found a shotgun with no ammo, so  I then started to walk around for more loot and bumped into anther player. He had an axe while I had a Shottie with no ammo even tho unknowingly he dropped his axe and begged bot to be shot. And so I took is axe and ran off.     The later on I met another guy in a small cabin and started talking to him, but suddenly 3 Russians came up and started shooting at our cabin.  My new companion said ''hey this is the end'', lets us run out there and Shout! Allu Akbar'' And so we did and managed to escape until I died from my wounds. My friend who bought the game with me in the first place met a guy and asked if he wanted to be friends, the new guy said '' Yes'' And so I and my 2 friends made are way to the construction site only to find a pile of guns from dead players in the woods on the way there. We then hunkered down in the construction site and started make a fire till I heard foot steps out side. We told them to drop there weapons after I seen them through a window upstairs, but of course they shot at us and we fought back, and I'm telling you now the way the game handles when it comes to PvP shooting feels so good and I actually thought I was In a big firefight, we were calling out info and places while hold up in the building and man is was good. Eventually we won and reaped the rewards :).  10/10

								DO NOT BUY THIS GAMEHistory of this game as I know it:Beta: the devs release an open world survival game set in siberia, it is developed to near completion and is a fun game although still has some quirks that need to be worked out.Summer version: Instead of fixing the game that already exists the devs decide that they want to make a WHOLE NEW GAME that occurs in the summer ( previous game was in winter) so do they take the previous game and reskin the terrain in summer green instead of artic snow? HELL NO they create an ENTIRELY NEW GAME that runs like crap because the whole map is covered with flowers that move in the wind, and devs obviously still havn't figure out how occlusion works. This version goes over like a lead baloon and in response devs DELETE THE ENTIRE FORUM! then they "re-release" the old version, which still works ok but they don't fix the bugs that people have known about for ever.Current (alpha?) version: Ok never mind that the devs don't know what way the greek alphabet goes ( beta comes after alpha) After almost a year of no communication at all with their community the devs announce the release of an ENTIRELY NEW GAME. Do they return to the best working most popular version of the game and fix teh known issues? HELL NO they release 3 tiny unfinished "sectors" and call it a game. Then they drop off the face of the earth for 2 months.. that brings us here. The game randomly bans people that can play it, doesnt' let many people play at all, and quickly gets old after you take an hour to explore everything that you can, get mauled by the packs of OP dogs, die from lack of water when surrounded by snow, or can't find any loot because other players have walled off all the buildings in protest (thats right you can build walls, but can't destroy them leading to the landscape being littered with imersion breaking impossible structures and sky grafitti. There is NO SUPPORT AT ALL for anyone who has an issue, and since it is EA you can not get a refund.Oh yeah.. and all the while the devs are trying to get ANOTHER game with the SAME ASSETS green lit on steam.. for once steam makes the right choice and tells them "um how about you guys finish the game you started first?" I thought this was a good game, but now it seems like a cash grab with asset flip every few months to make it seem like its still being worked on.This game has nothing but potential.. if only there was someone there to develop it.

content:
Posted: August 26, 2016
Early Access Review
								Survival Postapocalypse now! is perhaps one of the best games I have played, great PvP featuring easy communication with other players and a real fun game and with over one thousand hours gameplay under my belt I have met some really cool people to play with or against,  Unfortunately it has a lot of bugs, glitches and lag not to mention some other annoying factors  including a kill cam that gives away your position to the other players you are in combat with, however all these problems could be easiy fixed with some effort, yet there is no support from the developers ( who gave up answering their customers back in March 2016) and now the game is over-run with cheats, ridiculously over run by cheats. If you want to play this as an honest player then you can expect to be shot through a wall or from across large distances on the map with one shot kills, other players teleporting, Spawning in loot, duplicating  and  bringing in banned weapons to name a few dissapointments.Oh and as for bans... there is currently no way to ban cheats either permenantly or temporaily as there is apparently a cheat they can use to unban themselves. The game is ruined and now 90% of the players I meet use cheats, it's a shame because with a few tweeks this could have be an awesome game. Steam need to come down heavy on the developers for abandoning this game and for letting down every honest player who purchased this game in good faith. Shame on you TB Games, in any other industry you would perhaps have faced penalties  for allowing this game to go the way it did, but TB Games have gotten away with this complete lack of professionalism and hides behind this 'early access' malarkey. I would suggest that no one spends another cent on this game unless it is fixed and a competent  anti-cheat system incorporated. SHAME ON YOU TB GAMES. you let your community down

content:
Posted: September 17, 2015
Early Access Review
								Hi there, as you may have already noticed, I have clocked into this game well over 100 hours. I have been playing this game since early development and have seen the many "improvements" that have been made by developers. However, there is one thing that I need to address, one thing that really upsets me about the recent update you made (2 months ago) with starting off each user in a Prison. Take into consideration the element of simplicity, prior to when you implemented the Prison into the game, the game was simple, me and my friend had a favored area that had a church, several small houses, a wood factory and what looked to be a temple. Roaming around this area, meeting newcomers and inviting them into our journeys or killing them on the spot was the thing that made this game great. But you completely removed that, and it hasn't been the same since.I've played this game alot. Really, alot. And I have tried to love the whole Prison concept. Don't get me wrong, I thought, originally, it was great. Although it was a bit confusing to comprehend why you're a prison inmate who woke up with a major headache with a sudden post apocalypse on his hands, but believe me, I tried to enjoy it.But when I came to the realization that you removed the one area that I loved so much, my love for the game itself slowly disintegrated. This area was the common area for everyone to meet up and it was easy to navigate around, why remove it?The simplistic nature of the game was ruined, you haven't made any changes to this game in months and a game with such potential is slowly dying off me.You can also tell that this is slowly dying off others too, months back it was hitting online numbers of 470 to 600 and more, but now you'd be lucky if there were over 50 users online. This update and lack of improvements is evident now, surely.Please listen to one of your most loyal players, please bring back that area, and please get rid of the Prison or something. It really doesn't make sense. I highly recommend this game, I think that it has potential as I said, if the developers update it regularly and listen to its consumers. I want you to fix this. Thank you.

Early Access Review
								I buy the game for myself and a friend. We do the tutorial. I spend 15 minutes figuring out how the ♥♥♥♥ you open a door. I wander around for another 15 minutes because the tutorial doesnt tell me where to go. We spawn into a server. We appear in the middle of the freezing Russian winter, in a trainyard. We cannot meet up, because we are separated by a player-built indestructible wall. I find a revolver. I find bullets.I cannot load the bullets into the gun, even through the caliber matches. We finally meet up, and go exploring. After looting some buildings, I find a helicopter wreck. I go inside. I become stuck inside a wall, and cannot escape. My friend puts me out of my misery. I am left with a cam of my corpse, while heavy breathing sounds♥♥♥♥♥♥my ears at a massive volume. This continues for 5 minutes - I cannot respawn. I Alt+F4. This does nothing. I tab out, and am forced to close the game with task manager through guesswork, as the actual task manager window is obscured by the big black square that the game has turned into. I uninstall.3/10, a must-buy for hardcore masochists.

content:
Posted: October 18, 2016
Early Access Review
								I join the game and I'm greeted by the presence of another player. "Hello friend!" I say to him. He stares back at me intensely and doesn't mutter a word. As he raises his gun in my face I say to him, "I was wondering if you could possibly show me the ropes? I'm quite new to this game and-" and before I finish I hear a loud crackling static over his mic and in what I can only assume is a Russian accent he replies, "Uhh, English... Err, not so good." I think to myself, "What an exciting adventure this will be, he doesn't speak English and I don't speak Russian... Fantastic"Almost immediately we became great friends. Running around, finding loot, wondering what we were saying to eachother, what an experience it was. Our adventure however was short-lived. We arrived in a town where other people were looting, they were far more geared than myself or my Russian friend. He had a shotgun and I was alongside him with my trusty pistol in hand. A pistol he had given me. Not only was this man welcoming to me, but he trusted me enough to give me a fully loaded sidearm. An act of kindness which I will never forget.We tried our best to avoid people as much as we possibly could. We went into a house, 2 story, with lots of rooms. We were both upstairs when I hear a car approach and stop outside. "They got the jump on us man! Bail, Bail!" I yell. Franticly I try to escape with my greatest ally. He rushed downstairs taking point with his shotgun and I tried peaking from the window, but they were gone...so we thought. Suddenly I hear a ripple of shots being fired and my friend yells, "♥♥♥♥♥!" I rush to help him but he's already dead. In a split second I react to the sound of a gun being reloaded and I deduce that it's coming from behind the shed behind the house. I rush back there and fire every shot I can into the sad sack of♥♥♥♥♥♥that killed my travel buddy. "You've been avenged my friend..." I say out loud. "Oh♥♥♥♥♥♥.. Where is the other one? He's gotta-" But before I finish that thought everything went black and the respawn clock was counting down. I never did find out the name of my travel buddy, but I know he's still out there... somewhere. R.I.P. #NeverForget(True story by the way... As for my review. [Cons]The hunger system is a little crazy, not enough food in the game to stay alive for very long. The wildlife is relentless and are very hard to lose on foot. I also don't know how the vehicles work haha. The transitions into some areas don't work sometimes. There was a bug where when I dropped my gun it would lose it's ammo which has set me back a few times.--[Pros] The player encounters while sometimes can be tough to communicate with people, makes for very interesting gameplay. The exploration is pretty fun. You are limited to how far you can go but there's also a good chance of getting lost. I guess some would consider that a con but I like the feeling of not knowing where to go, that's all part of being an adventure game :P)I'm typing this late at night so it's probably riddled with spelling mistakes and punctuation issues and I don't typically do reviews so sorry if it was♥♥♥♥♥♥lol. I think the game is worth playing. I enjoyed it for a quite a bit.

content:
Posted: April 25, 2015
Early Access Review
								So far, so good, I just saw the game previews on Youtube, bought it, played it, and for an early alpha, looks great, Still, more needs to be done, Here's one of many of my suggestions:1 -> NO ZOMBIES. Seriously, I'm tired of zombie games, please don't add them, add other things, such as bandits for weaponry, scavengers for random loot/tools, Survivors for everyday needs (food).2  -> More AnimalsYup, we need more meat, more fur, because WINTER IS COMING!and we need to freak out the cold ice on our bodies.3 -> Stress SystemWell, It would be awesome if you could implement a stress system...It could be unique for the game... If you hear a wolf howling, it would scare you ingame, and the stress would rise..You hear footsteps? Well, time take a deep breath, and prepare yourself..Gunshots? RUN, or face courage yourself...That way, the more stress you have, the more that your hands would shake..How do you fix you stress?Simple, Lighter + cigarettes for the nerves, or a little vodka.Or, if you ain't a smoker/drinker, try to face your fears/stress, so that your used of your dangerous, that the word ''Stress'' doesn't mean nothing to you anymore. 4 -> You guys need to implement a ''Suggestions'' Board on your steam game's forum, so that people would suggest things for you, so that the game would be well received for us all...Everyone loves to have their ideas posted, and replied by the game developers.For now, this would be great addictions for the game, and I hope that the developers would consider my suggestions, along with others suggestions from the community.I hope, that in the future, I could add even more suggestions, a great hug/kiss for the developers, and I hope that you could construct a FABULOUS game!7/10 for a great early alpha gameCheers <3

content:
Posted: April 17, 2015
Early Access Review
								So I purchased the game today, I have enjoyed it...here is what I have found so far...1. Lost everything when I had to log out...bummer, had good loot...2. Mouse wheel changes between melee weapon and ranged weapon3. G key drops equipped weapon so you can drop revolver you found in drawer and pick up auto pistol you found in another drawer.4. double right click on ammo in inventory and click on matching ammo in inventory to combine.5. double right click on ammo in inventory and click on matching magazine in inventory to load magazine6. so far have not figured out how to put magazine into equiped pistol (maybe dont have correct magazine for the pistol)7. Do not know how to load rounds into revolver (maybe dont have correct ammo for revolver) R key should be reload, but with no control mapping layout hard to determine and with hitting random keys on the keyboard and no message coming up (wrong ammo for type of weapon equipped) hard to tell.8. Finding a backpack increases your inventory. YAY!9. Found gasoline/lighter fluid with second character10. Found lighter with third character11. Died by wolf with first character as I could not hit it with my barefists, respawn gave me a baseball bat to restart. Hitting random keys to figure out what key was reload logged me out of my character and sent me back to log in menu where I lost my whole inventory and had to start over (suck!) New character starter with baseball bat. Killed wolf, got meat. Cant cook meat...12. Found a map!!! shows the area, need to take a screen shot and print it out.13. Found lots of weapons, lots of food, lots drinks, cant carry them all, get hungry fast, get thirsty fast, cant find a place to rest...cant find a place to save so I dont lose everything when I log out, dont know how to log out without losing everything...cant use beds (or have not found a bed that is usable) found apartment buildings with doors that close, that are safe from elements and wildlife, but can not sit on chairs/sofas or sleep in beds.I recommend the game for the price, early access, but the game does need a booklet or a screen that covers keyboard commands and maybe a bit of a walkthrough.***just played after the patch***Okay, after patch, either I found the correct ammo or R now works to reload and I have correct ammo for the revolver, still dont have an automatic and magazines to check on that aspect yet. Getting cold too fast and this time around not finding any coats, however i did find an axe and hammer and started playing around with building a structure, then someone killed me, respawned and only found an axe so cant play around with the building aspect of the game anymore, but it is kind of fun. gonna check out the help system that was just implemented in the menu and see what that is all about.

Posted: December 25, 2016
Early Access Review
								Alright. I don't normally write reviews but I deemed this one necessary for everyone. An hour, a simple hour is all I needed to see what this game really is. I would constantly get harrassed by other players spawn camping in the old version. That's fixed now. But only to have arisen anew. There seems to only be 3-4 spawn points on this new map, and yes, they are getting camped again. When you do manage to make it out of the camp mania, you will not find any weapons, I spent a good chunk of my time looking for weapons in buildings and on other dead player bodies that somehow always seem to be laying around inside of walls.The hackers: ♥♥♥♥ loads, can't seem to get around the wasteland without running into atleast 5 in an hour. You'll see them flying, spawning stuff, and downright banning your account with some ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t cracked admin version of the game.The Anticheat: Doesn't Exist.RESEARCH: I did some research into this game and learned that this game is just a continuation of a FACEBOOK GAME. Yes that's right, this game was on facebook. It was originally on facebook, it also was only in russian and had no objective towards itself what-so-ever. FACEBOOK LINK: https://apps.facebook.com/survival_z/?fb_source=sidebar_bookmarkOverall I give this game 0/10.No creativityRehaul of a Facebook Game.Horrible MovementFeels like Infestation / WarZ all over again.

content:
Posted: July 8, 2015
Early Access Review
								I saw this game and it looked like a game my friend could run since he doesn't have a very good computer so we both bought it and he gets 30-35 fps which is playable for him so this game can run on low end pc's. The game is capped at 60fps from what i see and i don't know if they have plans to change that. This game also has a lot already developed into it like a variety of cars (cough cough dayz cough cough) and a lot of weapons, the problem though is it's really hard to find a gun atm because of people camping the places they spawn in giving them an unfair advantage. The spawns in this game should be different and you should spawn randomly on the map rather than spawning in the same area you died in, this would get rid of spawn killing. I hope if this game gets more popular they will add US Servers because 70% of the time you will find russian people and can't understand them so they KOS. This game feels nice and smooth and whats its worth i think its worth the $6. Devs have stated that they are adding better Anti-Cheat and are adding a new map soon.Overall i give this game a 7/10

content:

Early Access Review
								For the price it's fun to mess around with. I'd start in a low  pop server until you can figure out how the game works some because it's a bit frustrating at ttimes. Seems like there is always one more piece you need to have a working gun and while searching, BLAM, someone pops u in the head with their working gun.I have yet to find shoes. I have found hats, shirts, gas masks and even am officers lid but no shoes. I do run into this dude on a server every once in a while that only has camo pants and a really sweet pair of kicks! My one and only goal nopw is to get this gun working, find that server and hunt that dude down for his kicks and I will have won the game, imho!This game is getting better. The more you explore, the better it gets. Don't stay in the area they start you at. I'm not sure if everyone starts way south but it gets better the more you play so don't give up. It does get very frustrating at times and I hope the Dev's add a little more to the rng as I have spent over an hour looking for a lighter on this last play and if you are playing solo, you won't live long without finding one this long.Want a pretty cool story(I think it is)?   vv Down here vvhttp://steamcommunity.com/app/351290/discussions/0/620713633847744255/

Early Access Review
								What I liked: The overall feel to the game Travelling from one area to another area reduces the lag build up Not another Zombie survival game Crafting is good but needs improvement Noises are a bit loud but given you a chance at hearing people.What I did not like: Killed 10 times without even gaining a gun or some form of weapon Upon spawning in: Had nothing in Inv, not even a water bottle or snack. Opening and closing doors/hatches etc is a major pain in the♥♥♥♥♥ Pressed "E" 9 times before a door could be opened standing stationary. It's DayZ without Zombies, but instead major pain in the♥♥♥♥♥players.One senario:Joined a server, found a cabin, 2 more guys show up, Im wearing a gas mask and that's all no food or water or anything else.First guy: Think he has food?Second guy: Lets find outBefore I can even say "Im new, I do not have anything but this gas mask"Me: On the ground dead due to a shotgun blast to the head.First guy: He had nothingSecond guy: ♥♥♥♥ing Noobs man, wish they'd learn to play the gameSo now It's like Dayz without Zombies; with Rust's Community. Great.

content:
Posted: June 7, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game reminds me of a mix of The Long Dark, Rust, And DayZ(just no zombies). Although the graphics may not look as advanced as those titles i just referenced, you get past the fact that they are not that great. Remember this is an alpha. With that being said, alphas are meant to be tested and improved, therefore if you decide to buy this game dont expect everything to work how you would like it yet. I believe that after this game reaches its beta state it will be very successful.P.S. When you start playing expect to get killed a lot, and i mean A LOT. The Russians who play this game kill you pretty much no matter what you do, even if you just spawned. Also please dont press the cheater button out of anger, a lot of people are getting banned when they didn't do anything. It makes it hard for the developers to have to handle those cases, so please be considerate. Part of the game is getting killed, and if you dont like it this game isn't for you, otherwise add this title to your Steam Library.

content:
Posted: April 17, 2015
Early Access Review
								I do reccomend this game for 5 bucks, it is really fun, there are no zombies (it gives the game a more wasteland feel to it)  But DO NOT buy this game for the trailer you see, now of course I haven't explored the whole map yet because death seems to find me one way or another.  That is also another thing, you always spawn in the same general area, what I've come to call "freshspawn valley" where basically the game starts.  You move from area to area looting houses making it as far across the map until you die, if a player doesn't get you, its pretty much guerenteed a silent wolf, the cold, or accidently falling off a building will.  Back to the trailer thing, I haven't found many weapons beyond a 1911, 2 revolvers (which use the same ammo pretty sure there is no dmg diff), and a shot gun.  I've found ammo for other guns but I have searched and searched to find nothing, no mosins, no assault rifles, just double barrel shot guns, I haven't even seen an assault rifle mag..But that is just a warning about what you see in the trailer is not what you will be buying, the game is still entertaining and its very fun to explore and loot.  There is a good voip system so you can talk to people, idk how many english speaking players there are though because every person I come across speaks russian and that language barrier is impossible to overcome and it normally ends with someone dying.  With the way the melee hit detection currently is and the glitches I've found in the game I'd have to give it a 6/10 in this early access state, not to say that rating won't go up, I hope the devs work hard to improve this game and make it the great game it should be.

content:
Posted: April 21, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game is worth the $5 dollars! It's like DayZ but without zombies and is a very playable. If you want to play a DayZ like game, then this is for you. It also runs good on very low end PC's if you do happen to have one. Pros:-Runs well on older/lower end PC's-Very playable-Crafting is available-Updates everyday-Very fun with friends-Graphics are decent Cons:-Low player base-Everything is still very alpha-Clunky animations-No customizable settings other than graphics-Spectating after death which tells you exactly where other players are and what they have on them-Many players are Russian (From my experience) and most of them (Not trying to be offensive, yet again from my experience) are very agressive and will KOS. -Server hoppingI recommend you buy this game nevertheless as it will greatly increase the player base and will encourage the developers to keep working on the game.

content:
Posted: July 18, 2015
Early Access Review
								Sorry Devs, I really want to enjoy this game - trust me I do - but I really can't do that until you add a dedicated options/settings menu.For example: there's no setting allowing me to change my mouse sensitivity, therefore I'm having to do a full arc with my arm just to do a 180° turn. Other things are also prohibiting me from wanting to play this game further such as no option to change the FOV; the sound (it's really annoying when you jump and the character just roars 'HUUUUUUH' at me; also no key binding option.Honestly Devs these are just the small things I think you need to take a look at, I'm sure I'd have enjoyed the game if I'd played it for longer, I just can't seem to enjoy something when I can't tinker with the settings to make it play how I'd like to play - and I'm sure this applies to many other people too.I'll revist this game in a few weeks/months to see how it's progressed because I am genuinely looking forward to sinking some hours in to it once a few option features have been added.

content:
Posted: June 16, 2015
Early Access Review
								I'm going to change my previous reccomendation to a positive one now. I know it's been rough for me and I've posted my share of complaints but, I do feel the devs are working on the issues at hand and are trying their best to fix everything. The feedback they've been getting from everyone has more than likely, been of great help. The posts about glitching, loot finding, placement of this and that and about all the hackers in game. This is being taken care of or, so they say. However, they have mentioned several times that, they know who all is hacking and it will be fixed and to add, all those that are hacking, will be permanantly banned from all, S:PAN servers once the final released is ready. My most positive impression about the game is, it's definately running smooth. I've not had many games that run as smooth as this one does, even more-so, with an 159ms ping. No matter what server I'm playing on, the game runs great. Nothing concerning issues I've had with it are, per the servers the game is running on. They're up, 24/7 and have never crashed, that I know of? Switching from server to server is not an issue at all. Alt/F4 out, switch server and bingo, you're there. I'm not sure if this is true wth everyone though and I play it with a 64bit system, not a 32bit system. I also don't know if that has anything to do with it or, not? If I was having any actual connection issues with the game, I'd of quit playing it a long time ago and in my games profile, it would probably show you less than 30mins played. It's an Old School type of game play configuration and perfect for PC/M & KB players. Is it worth the $5-6? Yes, even more-so at this stage. The devs have already stated that, everyone playing it now, will get the completed, full version at this price and if not, the rest will have to pay the full price for the game once, it's released. So, if you got $5 to spare and want to help track down hackers, kill hackers and/or, all these frkn wolves/bears in the game, get it and when the final is ready, prepare to gank or, get ganked.As an added note: This game is playable on XP for those of you who still use them for lower end games..It's not a bad game and I have over 200 hours into it. I plan to have more.===============================Edit: It is not advisable to play this game on XP. A friend got it and it really messed up his system. He was getting very low fps in game and couldn't even create/join a server. He tried changing screen reso and it messed up the system once he left the game. Now, he can't return his screen back to it's normal scale. If you have a beefed up system with a version of XP then, it may work.

								This game is Extremely well done, it has ups and downs like any other game, but for the short amount of time this game has been up I have thoroughly enjoyed it. I would write an entire speech about this game but a short what they can add in my opinion would be best.What the developers could add to this game is chests and beds!! You can build a lovly base with nice rooms but there is no point. You can't sleep there and you can't store your items anywhere forcing you to take the bare essentials.Another thing the developers could add to this game is the ability to transfer your guns into your inventory. If this was implemented the game would be a whole lot better then it already is.These are just afew things i thought the developers could have added to make this game Better. One last thing, Remove the Esc Key Log. I use the Esc key to exit my inventory with every game and when I do it with this game it goes back to the main menu. Remove that Please it's very frustrating when I do it.I hope this review was helpful and Thanks for reading!

content:
Posted: July 6, 2015
Early Access Review
								Ok, there's a lot of bad opinions from people that haven't really tried to play the game, once you get further in the map, you get more stuff, everything is easier to do, guns aren't rare, don't get fully geared, get a gun with enough ammo and kill someone and take their stuff.Place I recommend to loot at for  major gear: FactoryYeah, there's hackers every so on, they spawn♥♥♥♥♥♥but aimbot/wallhack, I don't think so, the closest thing to wallhack that everyone uses is when their friend dies they spectate others in the area to tell them where you are.Glitches: One abused glitch is people glitch into the rock on the mountain and shoot people through it and not be seen, sometimes mods disapear off your guns when you die along with your shirt but dupes when you find another shirt of any kind.75% people you run into are russian, so watch yourself, most are aggressive in my opinion.Good things in my opinion: Spawns aren't over powered, mechanics are simple and clean (most at least), not many glitches, more development than DayZ Standalone.Bad things in my opinion: Too many wolves, they get annoying and constantly bite you, agro needs to be lowered, cars are a little too slidey while driving, some glitches that people exploit that get annoying. Fist can't be used. Easy to get stuck.The game is a little confusing but put time into it.ALSO MAKE SURE TO PLAY WITH FRIENDS

Your progress ultimatley gets stopped because your spending all your time running from kitchen to kitchen opening cabinents trying to stay alive and keep your items. It seems the game is rigged to offer you less drops the further along you get opening 100's of cabinets and finding squat. Wait until they patch or finish the product. current patch 8.6.8 alphaTLDR : (6/10 drop rates keeps your progress halted)

number of helpful: 9 of 12 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 9, 2015
Early Access Review
								For 5.99 you can get a great experiance in a post apocolyptic world. Honestly this game is worth every penny. It could even be put up against DayZ.One thing I wish I knew before buying this game is that it is Linear. You work your way through a map of multiple areas. Each new area having a different enviornment and different loot. Some areas will be filled with weapons and ammo. While others are filled with Food and Water. Some areas can be unforgiving lacking in food or weapons to defend yourself.Like any survival game it's always good to have a friend with you. So i'd recommed you grab a buddy and explore this world. Plus for this game being so under priced why not.In summary this game is worth trying.A great introduction into the survival game genre without dropping a $30 price tag. It's built quite well and I did not run in to any serious glitches.

number of helpful: 10 of 14 people (71%) found this review helpful40 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 11, 2015
Early Access Review
								For the price you pay for this, it's well worth it! I had some fun and got frustrated at times, but it has so much potential to be a great game, possibly better than DayZ!Some of my experience so far:- Spawned naked- Ran to nearby house- Looted some cookies and beer (nice) - Found a shirt and some bi*chin' shorts- Found a hat- Found a gun and bullets- Came across an abandoned apartment building and started looting- Hear footsteps coming up the stairs, so I draw my pistol and hide behind a table (perfect spot)- Guy runs in towards me wielding an axe wearing better shorts than me- I start furiously clicking to try and shoot him, only to find my gun wasn't loaded, and for him recieving a volley of clicks.- He strikes me twice, I let out a blood-curdling scream, then die.- Then as I gaze down upon my precious collection of cookies, beer, a gun and other items, I can't help but feel a little bit sad- He took my gun, beer, and my damn cookies...So that was my first experience, but I can say I'm quite impressed from what I saw. This game has a lot of potential and I am glad I contributed towards it. I just hope the developers won't abandon what could be an excellent game.

								Now.... I will just talk about it a little bit. I've played this game for a while, on another account, and i'm just here to tell you about the game.For this game's price, it's one of the best damn games i've seen. content:
Posted: May 21, 2015
Early Access Review
								The game is stable for what it is but has a few issues. If you enjoy survival games but you don't have a high end PC, this is the game for you. But if your looking for a survival game that looks good AND runs well without the issues this one has I suggest you buy another game. That being said it can be enjoyed for many hours. I have a few complaints. Fix the animal animations and the AI. Fix the constant loss of health for no reason. (i assume it's from the cold but there is no way to get warm at the moment, at least none that i can find and the fire doesn't help) And last but not least, PLEASE change the UI it can be annoying at times. 7/10 for now...

number of helpful: 12 of 19 people (63%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 6
Early Access Review
								So... the game is NOT totally dead like everyone wants to say. I have not encountered any hackers in my playtime. I have encountered several bugs but no crashes. There isn't a whole lot to do, but it is kinda fun if you aren't looking for anything complex. Graphics are okay and sounds are okay. Only NPC I've come across is a dog/wolf. Loot is fairly easy to find but ammo is another thing. I can find tons and tons of ammo but none that work with any weapons that I've found and I've found like 5 or 6 different types of guns. No guns spawn with ammo in them so that is annoying. I've encountered quite a few players and out of all of them (around 15 or so I would say) I was only attacked by 3 of them. I dropped 2 of them, and the other one got me. The map seems fairly large but I have been to the same building like 3 times since when you die, you respawn in the same general area so I kept running by the same stuff. There is no hud, and only a dot crosshair.Decent game for $2.50EDIT: I've now encountered one person who I truly believe was hacking. While I have no proof, I think he was hacking for the amount of ammo he had and the fact that he wouldn't die despite being shot multiple times and once in the head. He went fully automatic on a couple of guys and had to fire about 3 mags. Then he saw me and did the same thing with about 2 mags. I played for quite a few hours and couldnt gather more than about 20 rounds for a weapon type at a time. I even went to the military base but found not a lot.

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 8, 2015
Early Access Review
								Survival: Postapocalypse Now is great to play with friends and a great pass time game. Although... There are the downsides. A problem I've encountered many times now is being randomly "teleported" to a random area in the location. And i'm not the only one who has encountered this. Another major problem is the framerate. They need to fix this in the Hospital location especially seeing that I cannot turn around without my game stalling or dropping framerate. My specs are displayed in my profile description. I've also found that the game doesn't explain things very well. I spent at least an hour making sense of how the guns work and how the ammunition works. But I suppose that's just me seeing I don't have much experience with guns and how they work. Overall though, this game has potential. Besides the few bugs and glitches it's a very well made game for an Early Access title. I recommend this game if you are into Survival games and Russians especially, but at it's current state, I would wait for an update to fix those few major problems.

content:
Posted: May 17, 2015
Early Access Review
 IntroductionThis is a very interesting game, even though the developers are Russian, I am actually surprised this game is fun. However there is a downside to this game. Everyone who I have come across has CS aim. Don't know what CS aim is? No matter, the following paragraph will explain. After the first paragraph, I will talk about the game and a potential scenario you may find yourself in. What is CS aim? CS aim is referred to as Counter Strike aim, yes the game we all know and love. Basically everyone who shoots at you is probably a Global Elite; I say this because every battle I have been involved in always ends up with me being outplayed beyond, literally. I may be sitting in a bush (lots of foliage around me, basically impossible to see me) and people will locate my exact coordinate and fire at me, whenever I move, they will keep shooting without missing. So in conclusion CS aim is just the theory of someone never missing a shot no matter the situation. The GameThe game overall is actually quite fun, you will find yourself with a gun (eventually) and some ammo, and when you have this almost instantly you will hear footsteps, loud footsteps. Your heart will race and you will try to outsmart whoever this is, but always remember my theory, CS aim. You use your knowledge of the CS aim philosophy, so you camp it out a bit waiting for the person to appear before you, and when they do, you shoot, only to find out you didn't load the gun. The person is now identified as a white male, Russian ex Spetsnaz Praposhchik. The man drops to the ground and lights you up within a heartbeat... Now you wait 59 seconds to respawn. Conclusion 11/10 would play smart against ex Spetsnaz Praposhchik and forget to load my gun. gg

content:
Posted: July 29, 2016
Early Access Review
								Ok, first of all, there is a reason why this game is $5 (You get what you pay for). Now, for the game it's self, it's a cheap DayZ knock-off. Now, just because it's a knock-off doesn't mean it can't be good, However this game is awful. The game starts you in a tutorial (I think, since you never return when you die) The Tutorial is dark and doesnt tell you where to go or what to do (So, you'll be wandering for 5-10 mins) after the "Tutorial" it drops you in a sewer (Where you do re-spawn!) Now that your in the game, it's time for some real fun? No, only suffering awaits...... When your in te Sewer there is 0 lights and 0 direction (So quickly it becomes the story of a Russian man who goes crazy in a Sewer). After spending (Easily) 30mins- 1 hour, you'll begin the actual game. it drops you off, the (Obviously) you look for supplies (Since your a shirtless Russian man.) Strangley however, very close to spawn is a weapon/ammo spawn and, it's just terrible. I got 2 Mags for a Rifle and Suicidal thoughts. Now, Skiping over a lot of me running around looking for a shirt, I walked into some sort of diner (Maybe?), I was looting it, until I heard footsteps. A man in a Russian steel helmet with UN markings came out of nowhere, and (With the Revolver I found while wandering) I shot him 3 times. While looting him I took his helmet, gas mask, meat and Track suit (So I can be like true Slav.) Further down the road I found a Army base, this Army base was more of a "Army base" than I expected. I rolled up, and there were no zombies, however there were a family of (Quite) nasty wolfs. Little did I know this'd be a re-occuring theme. After shooting the dogs I found a AK-47 (Although it seemed larger than normal.) I couldn't find ammo anywhere (Also, never finding any ammo in the army base.) Around this time I realized that people could set down structures (The reason I know is because they were placed EVERYWHERE in the army base.) It was a appaling to see these towering walls of trashy wood covering sections of tents. After leaving the army base, I peiced it together that the threats in this game are Wolves, Players and Bears (If there are zombies in this game they played such a little role I cant remember them.) The rest of my game time was spent walking aimlessly through a swamp, cursed to never find my way out (Until I was mauled by Ninja Bear.)In Conclusion: Do you recommend this game?: No.Is this game fun?: No.Is there a reason to buy this game?: Yes! As a joke gift.Is it worth the $1.49 (That it costs on steam now?): Unless it's a joke gift.Would you recommend this game?: ...... (Did you even read this ♥♥♥♥ing Reveiw?!?!)What Experiences does this game provide?: The Suicidal kind.....($1.49 is too much, hell F2P is too much)       -10/10 Would wish for the sweet relief of death again -Wespen

number of helpful: 17 of 31 people (55%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 31, 2015
Early Access Review
								It's better than most of the games out there for $5, but it's still not worth it.The keyboard controls cannot be changed. They are what they are. This is what I hated the most. Also if you have an axe, hammer, or whatever you can't use your pistol unless you drop it. You can only switch between your primary and melee weapon if you have a melee weapon. If you have no melee weapon you are free to use primary and secondary weapons, but for whatever reason melee weapon takes over for your secondary weapon.Other players are lagging all over the place which makes it very hard to kill hostile players warping all over around me... I've killed 2 players in 2 hours. Could have killed a 3rd... Shot him in the face twice with a shotgun then I think he quit. All you have to do is hit ESC to exit a server instantly. Easy to combat dodge and Server hop for loot. The only thing that takes a minute is respawning after a death which makes you wait 1 minute. So I can combat dodge and server hop easily for loot but I can't respawn instantly. Makes so much sense! Also I can see where all the other players are on the server while I'm dead! GHOSTING ANYONE!? Anyway...I've only been killed by wolves or freezing to death... The community can't seem to aim or I'm just as laggy for them as they are for me. So back to freezing. You need an axe to get the wood, lighter fluid to put on the wood, and a lighter. Most lighters have 6% fluid in them that I have found and that is not enough to light the wood. I will usually have wood and lighter fluid and no lighter or i have a lighter and lighter fluid and can't find an axe and I freeze to death. The community is lame and annoying in VOIP... You can look at bushes with your crosshair to see if a person's name shows up so you know if someone is trying to hide where you can't see.I like the inventory system. All items take up 1 slot, you start out with 8 and a backpack only adds another 8 slots for a total of 16 slots. Meds are really hard to find and you can't combine anything together except for ammo. So I will have a lighter, lighter fluid, wood, 2 cans of food, can opener, 2 or 3 bottles of water, primary and secondary ammo, all the meds i can find, and still have room for more. You can't put weapons in your backpack for a buddy like in DayZ, but whatever...There is a map but no compass in game, but the map shows your general location. It's a small location compared to other survival games.Overall the game is just alright. I don't understand this mostly positive score. These people must have only played games in the 90s because this game has about that level of detail. The gameplay feels more modern but needs a lot more work. I've never played Rust, but I'm going to go ahead and recommend a game I've never played for an extra $15 cause this is the internet you all do whatever someone tells you to do on the internet.RESPECT MAH AUTHORITEH AND BUY RUST CAUSE I SAID TO!!!Or you can just save your $5 for the next big thing... It's up to you. It's your money and you are in control.

								My review for this game: Pros: +Price+Lot of players+Easy to learn map+Sectors(locations)+Loot system is good everybody can have loot its not like you go in and its clear.+Lot of guns and ammo types+Interesting looting you need to open door with "e" key and than you can grab your loot+Vehicles also but we need little bit more of them.+Anti-cheatCons:- Bad in-game settings (no settings) - Need settings for sensisivity - Inventory split ammo (you can stack your ammo but cant split)- Inventory for parts of your clothing.(no clothing inventory)- Chat(no chat ingame)(only voicechat.)- Hitboxes for dogs are very bad.- Starting with hands and you cant use them for selfdefense.(we need fist fighting :D)- No explosives(i dont know if they are some but i dont find any grenades)- ESC KEY >:(My idea: let us switch between pistol and maingun without throwing it out, its useless have pistol if i must drop maingun on the floor and than grab it back.Game is good but it need more fixing and settings i think it have future but devs must work on it.

Early Access Review
								I have played around 17 hours on this game. I do not recommend if you are new to gaming, new to computer gaming or do not like being killed alot. Seriously. This game had potential, but the second someone else sees you on the game, they kill you. They run in packs to protect themselves, so if you dont have a group that is armed and carrying good gear, do not expect to get ANYWHERE in this game. Items are just impossible in this game. Either you find food but no drinks or ammo and no guns or clothes and nothing else or some rediculous combination. If it isnt the people that get you, it is the cold or the bears or the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ed dogs. Cannot find melee weapons for♥♥♥♥♥♥either. too dark to see♥♥♥♥♥♥at night, can never find flashlights and batteries and even if you do, you run  the risk of others seeing you, so again....dead.If people quit being♥♥♥♥♥♥♥and let you be, you might get somewhere in this game, but no, they kill you to scavenge what measley stuff you find. I dont recommend this game at all. I like it, but the people make it bad.

content:
Posted: June 7, 2015
Early Access Review
								*This is already better than of what RUST or DAYZ standalone has become. Like seriously, those games are dead. PROS:+ A lot of action+ Not grindy+ Works smoothly on hi graphics with medium pc.+ Combat is much better than in look-a-likes (rust).+ Enviroment feels alive+ Hunger/thirst/temperature are there to create survivalish feeling. Not to annoy you, and not to be ignored forever. +Lots of loot, alive combat (magazines, rounds, weapon conditions)+ Very nice post-apocalyptic enviroment.CONS:-Full of russians. (the ones that completely ignore the fact that english is worldwide lang).-Crafting is messy and unclear o.O-NO DOORS. Again, no doors. Like, you cant have a base YET.-NPC enemies are buggy for the moment.-Weapons condition might be changing too frequently.-Instad of one-open-world there are these 'zones' that you pass. Map is divided into the zones. Loading screen each time u enter a new zone. Annoying as f**k.Overall: 7/10.   After they add doors ill give this game 8/10. Still needs some polishing, but i'd say i would buy this game for 15$ anyway. AFTER THEY ADD FREAKING DOORS -.-

								Best $5 ive ever spent, this game is actually better than dayz and H1Z1 at the moment, they have way more guns than dayz, more realistic loot style than dayz and H1Z1 and this game is actually challenging. The environment is most hostile i have come across, not rust, dayz or Reign of kings can even compare, almost everyone is out to kill you, mainly russians.10/10 WOULD CAMP IN A WAREHOUSE WITH A SAIGA AND YELL "WOLVERINES" WHILE MOWING DOWN ROUGHLY 12 PEOPLE.

content:
Posted: June 11, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game is very intresting... I will start with some pros and list some cons. Please be aware this is a brief review and doesn't go over the whole game. Pros: -Pretty cheap being 5 dollars, good price for it atm. -OK variety of weapons-People don't always Kill on Sight (Of course this might change if this game becomes more popular)-Not a usual "apocalypse" survival game, instead of zombies or mutants it has real animals such as bears and wolves.-You can go into most buildings-Food, Liquid, and Temperature system, runs somewhat sturdy except at times you can freeze to death quite easy without gasoline or an axe.Cons: -The map is extremely confusing-There are different "sections" of the entire map-Bears are OP and can usually one hit you-Most clothing does not provide any buffs and doesn't help warmth but is just for looks.-There are only around 2-3 types of rifle weapons atm, and there should be more.-Graphics are ok.-Hard to find other players at times.-Early Access.This is my review, but if you really want to know what the game is like, go ahead and get it. It is worth it if you do decide to get it, trust me, it's worth the five dollars. And that's about it.

content:
Posted: June 3, 2015
Early Access Review
								Ok lets see. I played the game several hours now and the more i play, the less fun it makes. But i will make a pro/ contra list, so see for yourself.Pro:-For an Early Alpha Version it works pretty well. Stable ingame, sometimes hanging up upon switching between parts of the map, but all in all pretty smooth-5 Euro is really cheap, so if you dont like it, you dont waste much moneyThats it for the real pros...Contra:Environment:- Snow everwhere...exept for the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ marsh...else snow, snow, snow- the same 5 houses, with the exact same inventory everywhere, exept for a school, a church and an industiral complex- only 2 npc enemies, wolves and bears randomly spawning, even right after start where you just run for your life- a really bad and small inventory...if you arent lucky to get a bag sometime, you are just running around with 8 slots...gg- if you pick up a handgun and an axe, you can switch between them...then you pick up an shotgun and can switch between axe and shotgun, but to choose your handgun you have to drop axe or shotgun...and if you want to carry axe and hammer, to build something, you cant carry a big gun to defend yourself..gg- First half of the game is farming food n weapons in the first 2 villages...farm them, switch server to reset the villages and the loot, farm again. Then you can either go through an endless pretty empty marsh, swimming through icewater, so make a fire every 5 metre, or get 2 hit killed by a bear.Or you got lucky and get fuel for an engine in a bunker to use an elevator to get through...what will happen like 1 of 1000 times.BUT...you will rarely get that far. You waste an hour looting houses, just to get shot by anyone spotting you. I dont know what kind of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ play this game, but they dont get the survival part...working together or so...nah...kill anything moving, to steal his loot. You could beg for mercy, but 95% of the players are russians who dont speak english and even if they understand you, they dont give a ♥♥♥♥.So its just, loot, die, restart at 0....again and again and ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥IT AGAIN.So better spend 20 Euro more for a better survival game, like the forest.Update:Another great job...now they added an prison as starlocation....so you waste 10 minutes running through an empty building with 5000 doors, finding no loot at all...at least nothing useful, like ammo for the imaginary gun you received yet or a portable radio without batteries.And after you managed to get out there, some russian ret.ards just sit outside waiting for some unarmed guy to show up, just to instantly kill you. Good Job, now the game is completly unplayable, since you always! (yes i tried it on 13 servers now, everytime, killed after prison) die by those no life inc.est bas♥♥♥♥♥♥♥I want my money back! Now!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 22, 2015
Early Access Review
								Edit: While I still find the game enjoyable, there are some glaring bugs that are beginning to surface. Such as how there is a random chance that when you phase into a new area that the game will completely freeze. You can hear your guy jumping around and moving, but it just sits at the "Connect to Server" screen. Myself, and a couple of my friends have experienced this same error and it can be super annoying (especially when playing together).For $5 I have had more fun in this game than most $50-60 game. It is surprisingly polished for the price, but at the same time it is obvious there is a lot of room for improvement. I would consider this a much more simplified, fast paced,  version of Rust. I think the main thing that needs to be worked on at this point is the inventory management. It could definitely use some improvement.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 29, 2015
Early Access Review
								Hello,The Full Controller Support that was implemented into the game doesn't work and hopefully will be fixed soon, because I like many like to play games in a more relaxed state generally, and keyboard and mouse just doesnt work anymore, unless you are a programmer or super-GEEK! The thermal update to use clothes as well as other items is a BIG+ as in to not have to worry about dying so quickly searching for the other rare items to find that would help you with thermal protection. HEALTH !, as in there needs to be a way or more items in areas to keep you from dying from lack of good health including lowering the amount of dogs in an area would greatly help.  Ammo needs to be close by that actually works with the gun and descent amount when you pick up a gun, gas container for vehicles of all types as well as generators or machinery needs to be in more areas, and the constant putting you in the swamp when you are more then two areas ahead of it, needs to be fixed as in not fair to always spawn that far back from where you died, as well as a driveable boat or two needs to be put in the swamp, pre-fabricated traps (e.g. bear trap) and the ability to make a trap (e.g. nature tarp with spiked pit below) needs to be added into the game. Last but not least for now scuba diving gear for fun and finding items under water would be a nice new added feature. In closing thanks for listening to your customers and future customers of this great potential game that I believe will be the best survival and then some type of game in a long time when it's finally completed or completed enough for a final release that I'm sure will have updates even then ;)                                                                                                                                                        Sincerely  ̿'̿'\̵͇̿̿\з=( ͠° ͟ʖ ͡°)=ε/̵͇̿̿/'̿̿ ̿ ̿ ̿ ̿ ̿                                                                                                                                                                             a fan of STEAM™

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 1, 2015
Early Access Review
								It's quite entertaining, for 5 bucks way better than i would have expected. I know this is alpha, and so I feel like really that bad things are important here for the effort of fixing them.1. The effect on the water, Literaly makes me nauseous, I'd honestly rather play not even being able to see the water just so i don't have to worry about running into it. In fact it actually makes playing difficutl and have to cut out regularly. (its the wavy effect on the water, its awful, the reflection is fine, just the movement turn it off? or i don't even know what to suggest, I wouldn't be surprised to find other folks that have this happen).2. Is there an armor value to items? i whack a guy with an axe 5 times, he's fine, he turns around and shoots me and i die? This isn't the first time, the first time, i shot a guy with 4 shots from a shot gun center mass, and then he shoots me with a nine 3 times and i die,... not really motivating. I play shooters, im not concerned about my aim, not to mention the little blood spurt from the guy your hitting, it's pretty obvious when your connecting.3. I come on to play, make it through an entire zone, when i load into the next zone, i get killed by apparently nothing and get the jarred kitty folks seem to have mentioned. 4. I don't get the point of building, no one seems to use it for anything except to keep new players out of houses to loot for stuff, OR, once i zoned into a section, they build a house at the zone area with no doors, so i was stuck inside and had to suicide out since i didn't have an axe. The only purpose building seems to serve, is to screw with new players, nobody does anything funcional with it, and considering i've been half way across the map before, it seems to only be a useful mechanic if your an @##&0l3. Turn it off? Also should probably make foundations destructible, for that reason since they don't seem to break.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 10, 2015
Early Access Review
								At £4.99 this game is what you should expect for such a low price tag. They say the objective is to survive, but it's nothing more than a fairly small deathmatch arena, spread across a few small, lightly populated zones, each as bleak and barren as the next. You spawn in, you try and find guns and ammo raking through draw after draw and cupboard after cupboard, if you don't get ganked doing that then it's time for you to go do the ganking until your ammo runs out or you die, then repeat.I'm not sure what I was expecting, not alot because it's so cheap, but it's not my cup of tea, as they say! Theres no purpose, just a really old looking fps with very very light survival aspects, including a hunger meter that goes down ridiculously quickly and a building system with zero purpose at all.Not recommended, it's not bad, it's just not worth anybody's time lol.

But Im going to keep playing it and say yes for now. Kind of. As long as you dont mind that nothing works and if there is one person on a server they have all of the weapons, can find you very fast, and just KOS you.Seriously, even in Early Access you need to be able to use the items taht you find. Out of all of the spawns Ive played now only one actually allowed me to select an item in my inventory. Allof the other times it was stuck on the same slot. So I couldnt select the food or water that I found to remedy my condition.Player who kept killing me was actually facing the wrong way when he shot and killed me (180 degrees the wrong way) and he was able to float across the whole map. Seems legit.Ive played worse Early Access games but not many this bad. But its under $5. You dont even get a shirt for that. Im serious. You dont get a shirt.

content:
Posted: May 7, 2015
Early Access Review
								You know those games that you look at and think"Eh, this has gotta be so♥♥♥♥♥♥quot;Then you play it and realise its realy good?This is that game.PROS:If you're into DayZ Or can't afford Arma 2 and Operation Arrowhead, this is what you want.The first part on why this is a good map is if you ever find a map, you'll notice its just a road, when you need to get to another area, it will fast travel you there.Next, is if you go onto lets say Server 7 then your game crashed, then suddenly Server 7 gets full, if you go onto Server 5, you'll have all of your items!Also, there is base building, I personaly havn't used that yet, but it's alot like rust is seems!The looting system is great, You'll find weapons, axes, guns, hammers in weapon locker, food, drinks in fridges and drawersThe final pro? Its £3.CONS:Community, its questionable, if you dont have a mic, your ♥♥♥♥ed, This brings me tp the next con!Theres no chat menu, therefor if you have no mic, you can't say your friendly or communicate!Thats it, This game is icnredible for what it is, Buy it whilst you can, price may vary up and down!So yeah, jsut buy it, right now, im waiting.Still waiting.
