content:
Posted: July 28, 2015
Early Access Review
								We all have that moment in our lives when we're playing DayZ/Miscreated/H1Z1 that we think to ourselves "Man, I wish this game was a deathmatch game so I could kill without the slightest feel of guilt.". Well, that dream has come true. This game puts the Deathmatch/Team Deathmatch game in an open world like DayZ. Where you need to collect items and get hungry and cold and stuff. In this game, you don't have to have any guilt when killing players because it's deathmatch. You can kill hundreds of players without doing anything wrong. I've played it 18 hours so far and I've really enjoy it. It's only 5$ and its really worth it.Best 5$ I ever spent!

content:
Posted: May 27, 2015
Early Access Review
								I give this game 10/10!!!  I've been a fan of the survival games since the DayZ Mod came out for Arma II.  This is now one of my favorite games to currently play (I play DayZ, H1Z1, and Miscreated)!  This is a great game to play with friends (the cost makes it an awesome game to buy for other people) or you can play it solo and "hope" to meet some random battle buddy.  Some of my best gameplay has been teaming with some random guy or girl that I meet in game.  RIP all my lost Random Battle Buddys.... :(If you approach this game with an open mind and a sense of humor, you will NOT be disappointed! :D   This game will provide hours of laughs, suspense, and the occasional heartache.  xDI highly recommend this game!

								This is definitely a must try for those who love a good atmospheric adventure/survival against nature. This game is based around Russia where snow and rain is very common in its cold climate. Give it a try!

content:
Posted: May 29, 2015
Early Access Review
								Hello,The Full Controller Support that was implemented into the game doesn't work and hopefully will be fixed soon, because I like many like to play games in a more relaxed state generally, and keyboard and mouse just doesnt work anymore, unless you are a programmer or super-GEEK! The thermal update to use clothes as well as other items is a BIG+ as in to not have to worry about dying so quickly searching for the other rare items to find that would help you with thermal protection. HEALTH !, as in there needs to be a way or more items in areas to keep you from dying from lack of good health including lowering the amount of dogs in an area would greatly help.  Ammo needs to be close by that actually works with the gun and descent amount when you pick up a gun, gas container for vehicles of all types as well as generators or machinery needs to be in more areas, and the constant putting you in the swamp when you are more then two areas ahead of it, needs to be fixed as in not fair to always spawn that far back from where you died, as well as a driveable boat or two needs to be put in the swamp, pre-fabricated traps (e.g. bear trap) and the ability to make a trap (e.g. nature tarp with spiked pit below) needs to be added into the game. Last but not least for now scuba diving gear for fun and finding items under water would be a nice new added feature. In closing thanks for listening to your customers and future customers of this great potential game that I believe will be the best survival and then some type of game in a long time when it's finally completed or completed enough for a final release that I'm sure will have updates even then ;)                                                                                                                                                        Sincerely  ̿'̿'\̵͇̿̿\з=( ͠° ͟ʖ ͡°)=ε/̵͇̿̿/'̿̿ ̿ ̿ ̿ ̿ ̿                                                                                                                                                                             a fan of STEAM™

								SURVIVAL: POSTAPOCALYPSE NOW DIARYGot in the game, found a dog, got killed because I was too much of a pansy to use my fists.Respawned, found some guy looting the building, said hi, didn't respond, I got shot in the back by some other guy.Several hours later, I've finally got some good gear. I've got my backpack, clothes, shotgun, plenty of ammo and an axe. I was looting a church-like place when I saw a guy in there. Told him to keep calm and that I had no intention of shooting him. He looked at me, stepped closer, bashed me in the face with a hammer. I blew his brain to bits. I bled for about 20-25 minutes, going through town to town while looking for some medicine. After 6 diffrent towns, I came up with nothing. Spent my last five minutes jacking off into the mostly abandoned lands of Siberia.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 7, 2015
Early Access Review
								My opinion - better than DayZ in many ways, but DayZ is for a bit more "hardcore" survival players. This is more casual. I started to play this game, didn't know squat about it. 4 hours in - me and my buddy are armed to the teeth and exploring the map. Making nice camp fires, roasting wolf meat and talking about those nice times when we had a car and were driving around (sadly some glitch took it away). We cleaned our weapons and eat some sardines (not only they feed you, you can satisfy your thirst from them - they are the best), added a nice red dot mod for my assault shotgun and onwards we went. If I had to say it to you the easy way - this is going to be something like DayZ + Rust (but without zombies). You roam around and scavange for resources, but you can chop down the trees, craft items together and make your own little base building. Will see how it develops, it was really fun and really interesting for the first 4 hours, will play some more when I get the time. If you have to ask me - at this moment, for 5 euros - depends on what you want. I bought it and I am happy with my purchase. I am sure that I will sink many many more hours into it.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 21, 2015
Early Access Review
								The game is definitely worth the $5.  Pros1.  Game runs pretty smooth.2.  Great possibility of finding a human fast.3.  Being able to interact with cabinets and lockers.4.  Base building/crafting.Cons1.  I can't punch an enemy!!!!!2.  It's almost impossible to hit a dog/wolf with melee.3.  Not as realistic as I'd like.4.  Too much rain and snow!!!5.  Don't like running to the end of map and taking me to another server.6.  Spawning at the same spot others spawn in.7.  No third person view/option.*Great game for only being out this April.  Really hope more effort goes into tweaking this game which has so far had a fine start.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 10, 2015
Early Access Review
								At £4.99 this game is what you should expect for such a low price tag. They say the objective is to survive, but it's nothing more than a fairly small deathmatch arena, spread across a few small, lightly populated zones, each as bleak and barren as the next. You spawn in, you try and find guns and ammo raking through draw after draw and cupboard after cupboard, if you don't get ganked doing that then it's time for you to go do the ganking until your ammo runs out or you die, then repeat.I'm not sure what I was expecting, not alot because it's so cheap, but it's not my cup of tea, as they say! Theres no purpose, just a really old looking fps with very very light survival aspects, including a hunger meter that goes down ridiculously quickly and a building system with zero purpose at all.Not recommended, it's not bad, it's just not worth anybody's time lol.

								  Fun and easy to get right into.  Just have to say be on the look out for russians and american teens who enjoy saying "you got rekt". Be careful of who you let live around you espically people who say nothing and young sounding americans.  They enjoy stabbing you in the back.  I looked into the reviews of this game and saw everyone saying the same thing about the russian player base.  And in game I found this out to be true.  They are usally well armed move in groups of two and always open fire on you before talking.  I enjoyed hunting them down and every time I killed one they would say in a heavy russian voice "I not Russian".  All and all for the price, fun game to pick up and play.  I give this a 7 out of 10 and only because of the graphics but besides that good fun.

A great game things i'm listing what i like and things i don't really like**Things i love about the game**1.The game to be is basically DayZ, but with no thirdperson and the price is a MAJOR price downage.2.I may run the game with 30 fps but i can tell you, the gameplay is nice and smooth and easy to control.3.Sprinting does not run out quicky!4. I think finding stuff in this game is a little to hard, thirst and cookies are quick to find but guns and ammunition are rare.5.Backpack space should could a little more thing just 2 more added layers........6.Ladders and stairs could actually should have a animation for both of them.But in conclusion i really LOVE this game, just a few simple mistakes in there. Plus the game is in beta to it's not fully finished. Overall, i learn from my mistakes in this game. That's why now i a auto machine gun and some good gear.9/10   Just like DayZP.S. The price of this game should be higher like 10 or 14.99

content:
Posted: April 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								It is still a very basic game. But I am wondering, what is the purpose of it? What is the goal? If it is to survive, there are very limited resources to do so for a long period of time. If it is to be the main survivor, meaning to go around and shoot eachother for as long as possible, kk, I understand, just need to make it easier for weapons.Suggestions for improvement: -Make it so that you can put multiple logs on a fire so it will go for longer and so that you can restock it as you want and can keep a fire going so you can explore a bit and not have to use too many resources. -Herbology is a great skill to have in games like this. Maybe make it so that you can harvest herbs and stuff to make the medicines. Also maybe make it so that if you were to pick up extra clothes, you could turn them into bandages. Or even chop up furnature to get some bandages and wood.-A melee option so that if you don't have any weapons, you can actually hit people/animals. Maybe make it so that additional force can be used to bring down small trees? i can understand not the big ones, but at least the small ones. -When you have a map, have the 'M' key available to open it up without having to go through the inventory. Also, I didn't see any compasses, so it would be nice to know where north is.Would I suggest this game? When it is more completed and has an actual goal in mind, other than to survive (like to find some sign of civilization instead of everyone running around killing eachother, or something to that effect), I will def suggest the game. Graphics are good, never got stuck. The whole idea is over-used, but is still good in this format. I always do suggest trying something new when making games.

content:
Posted: June 1, 2015
Early Access Review
								The game is good for the price of $5. You got looting, weapons, crafting, building, and survival that makes the game enjoyable and worth the money. But there are many things that need to be changed/add/fixed.- Change esc into menu, honestly using the esc as a logout of server button is kinda stupid and annoying.- Add the ability to give your character name and customization.- Have the map tell you where you are, really the map is so confusing and just gives you the names of the area without giving you your exact location.- Add more threats, wolves and bears aren't enough.- Add some kind of crafting or combing guide to help new players.- And most important of all, let us switch to our 3rd weapon, there is absolutely no way for us to access our 3rd weapon unless you drop one.Overall, this game is good for the price and it is still early access, so hopefully they will fix and improve the game. If you can get this game now for $5 then it is worth the money.

content:
Posted: January 19, 2016
Early Access Review
								Please know that I didn't buy this game. I got it in a giveaway.I'm going to give my First Impressions of this game, if you just want to get a quick glance at what this game offers, skip the first Impression bit, and check out the Pros and Cons. First Impressions I begin in a lit prison cell, i immedietly grab a screw driver and a lighter laying in the cell. I quickly pick the lock, and walk out of the cell, into an almost pitch-black prison... Which had me frightened... Would another character be sneaking about to get a few fresh spawn kills? Well no. I ended up just waltzing about in the dark for ten minutes until I grew tired and looked up what I needed to do. Ah, the torch in the prison cell can be picked up...Now since I have a light source, I quickly pick a lock, and jump into a sewer. As I waltz about in there, suddenly lightning flashes, and it begins to rain...In a Sewer, under the Prison...I soon manage to find a hole, leading to a loading screen... Taking me out finally into (What I thought hopefully) was the open-world. I waltz'd about for a little while around a trainyard, till I found a backpack. I left and followed a road... Which after five minutes of walking, took me to a loading screen. It was at this point I said ♥♥♥♥! Don't tell me this game has area loading screens! I found myself at what would appear to be a dinky little military outpost. As I would past it, I suddenly am flashed with another loading screen, as I then suddenly load back ALL THE WAY BACK THE TRAINYARD, WHERE I SPAWNED!?!? *sighs*My character starts to complain about being hungry and thirsty... Nonstop. Then he starts complaining about 27.3 C Temperature to be really chilly... WHAT!? Maybe 27.3 F... But 27.3 C is a bit... Warm.I FINALLY come across something, a bear. I swing at it a f- Dead.W-What!? No!? NO! I have to do that stupid prison opening again!?*Flash forward...* Climbing up a mount- Wtf!? I just TELEPORTED BACK AT THE TRAINYARD AGAIN!? WTF!?!?*A little while later* How do I eat? How do I drink!? I am clicking left and right, spamming the E button... SPAMMING ALL THE KEYS TO JUST FIGURE OUT HOW TO EAT AND DRINK!!!THIS was where I considered to stop playing.I mean... This game is broken. BROKEN. Empty as well. less then 60+ players total, and only 10 being on the most populated server. (Perhaps it would be best to remove a couple servers, and only have like 1 or 2 for the current population as of now.) Pros -Devs just got back to working on this game! Will change the review as development takes shape.-Vehicles, including Cars and Helicopters... Apparently. I never did find any.-The Graphics aren't that bad, and the game runs pretty smoothly. Cons -Broken... Just UTTERLY BROKEN. Ex. Spawning back in for me gave me double of all my items...-Inv. right now is a mess. (Update) The issues with eating and drinking was a glitch which didn't let me access any of my food or items.-No Character Creation-Voiced Acted Character... No, I think the characters shouldn't be voice acted. Just let the players do all the talking.(Seriously, the character just whines and moans non-stop.)-Very LOW playerbase.-More a recommendation, perhaps have an option to disable having to go through the long and dull process of the Prison. Conclusion? Survival :Postapocalypse Now is a very EARLY Early Access Game, on the lines of development so far. This is one of those times I wish steam had a So-so option to recommend. The devs show great potential, but right now the game is an utter mess. I'll come check it out again after a couple updates and PRAY it improves. :)

content:
Posted: September 14, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game is a good example of early access creating a positive dialect between players and devs.The game has gone under many changes since debuting, many driven by player requests (within reason so far).The actual game experience can be punishing, but for good reason. Lots of tedious and time consuming looting, typically only to then get blindsided by a stacked freak, or a group of them. The other side of that coin is that kills are meaningful and massive adrenaline dumps. It's actually a refreshing take on the value of a single life - while most games downplay the significance of a single life and create callused gamers.

content:
Posted: June 9, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game has many, many issues.Firstly, it's impossible to create your own server since the patch, meaning you are duty bound to play on a server full of annoying kids from faraway countries who just kill you instantly. Secondly, it's full, and I mean FULL of glitches whereby you get stuck and have to kill yourself or remain trapped. Loot is impossible to come by on the empty servers... I see people (who are probably hacking) with amazing guns and seemingly endless supplies of ammo, while it takes me about an hour or two of play just to find a basic gun in good condition. The spawning system is particularly annoying: the prison spawn is ages away from anything good and takes too long to get away from. Also, players quite often ruin the game by boarding up useful buildings with the build tool. The devs claim that you can destroy player-made buildings, but you can't so if someone decides to do that (which they often do) the game is ruined. Oh, and they've ONLY JUST added in an option to change the graphics, although you still can't change mouse sensitivity, christ knows why.This game needs much, much work before it'll be playable.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 28, 2015
Early Access Review
								Absolutely worth $5.Melee combat has a lot to improve, but guns feel pretty solid and they're not as rare.The game world is big, it has lots of buildings as well as open space to set camp or even build a home, but has some loading screens inbetween areas (I think it's because apparently this game was on facebook first), which I'm hoping will go away as development progresses.There's a decent amount of loot, and different kinds of food and clothing, but some essentials are somewhat scarce.The graphics are good looking, movement and performance is smooth, and the system requirements are pretty damn low.The game world feels a bit empty in terms of ambiance, there should be more road signs and destroyed cars and rubble on the roads, but it's alright since the game is still on alpha and I imagine the devs are focusing more on gameplay and loot/content.Playing with friends is the best way to play. But surprisingly, there are many friendly players, so even if you're playing solo you might end up in a group. Don't worry though, there's also a lot of hostile, lone wolf kind of players and raiding groups, so sooner rather than later you'll come across some crazy guy that'll try to KOS (which, IMO, adds to the fun). Playing with friends and facing another group of players is interesting and fun, sometimes they'll trade and offer their help, or simply shoot you out of fear. I highly recommend getting this game, really cheap and fun.

content:
Posted: June 25, 2016
Early Access Review
								I took an honest go at liking the game but after 15 minutes of navigating an empty prison and only finding empty cupboards and no clues on how to get out, I resigned to the fact that I was probably stuck here.  All of the doors were opened, all locks picked, and the only thing I got out of my time was a pair of bright blue shorts and a mild case of motion sickness.  The game itself seems interesting but the concept of waking up in a prison as the only survivor, with a screwdriver and lighter locked in the cell with you, seems unbelievable.  The prison would better serve as an exploration point than a puzzle.  This is listed as a survival game and I've come to understand that they should be open-world.  This feels too sandbox like from the start to make me want to continue playing.And let's not even talk about server population.  The recommended server had 12 users...It seems like very few survive long enough to even play the game.

content:
Posted: June 17, 2015
Early Access Review
								Pretty good game. Has some bugs and optimization issues, but it's got potential.The good:-Lots of different guns to find-Working vehicles (suck it, dayZ)-Crafting-Only five bucks-Loot isn't too hard or too easy to find. You can actually die of dehydration, freezing, and hunger without being just some complete noob-Unique winter settingThe bad:-Many bugs, including a black screen bug (never go to the Marsh. they may fix this, but I haven't found out if they did yet)-Lots of KoS-When your character starts to freeze, get dehydrated or hungry, etc, he becomes very annoying with his complainingI'll give this game a 7/10. I haven't played with friends yet, but I imagine that'd make it about an 8/10 for me.

content:
Posted: June 17, 2015
Early Access Review
								Pretty good game. Has some bugs and optimization issues, but it's got potential.The good:-Lots of different guns to find-Working vehicles (suck it, dayZ)-Crafting-Only five bucks-Loot isn't too hard or too easy to find. You can actually die of dehydration, freezing, and hunger without being just some complete noob-Unique winter settingThe bad:-Many bugs, including a black screen bug (never go to the Marsh. they may fix this, but I haven't found out if they did yet)-Lots of KoS-When your character starts to freeze, get dehydrated or hungry, etc, he becomes very annoying with his complainingI'll give this game a 7/10. I haven't played with friends yet, but I imagine that'd make it about an 8/10 for me.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 31, 2015
Early Access Review
 For the DevsFrom what I've played of the game, it's a lot of fun. I've gota few things I'd like to see changed. Here they are:-Wolves/Dogs - Too hard for new players to kill.They have a very large detection range and are ruthless,and finding gear when you freshly start is hard with them around.-English - There's some mess ups in the game's text. Most notablywhen you're running out of food, it says "Low Hungry," or "Low Thirsty."This should be cycled as (Fine, Hungry, Very Hungry, Starving.)-Communication - There needs to be a way to type to players.-Boundaries - I find it easy to get lost when going around, and when you go out ofbounds, the screen goes dark and resets you in a new spot. There should just be invisible walls,so you don't have to wait.-Loot - It's hard to get. Food and water and ammunition especially. I also found a problem with carryingmultiple weapons, if you have a pistol, primary and melee, you can only use the primary and melee weapons,the pistol is unusable unless you drop the melee. There needs to be more ammo, more inventory space,and more loot spawns/drops in general. -"Help" menu - There needs to be a brief tutorial for the game somewhere, when I first got it I was veryconfused for about an hour.-Health - More medication needs to spawn. So many times I've looked for it, and I die from a wolf bite, thirst or hunger, or some various thing that could have been easily treated. I feel that the food should restore health, the variance in quality determining the amount. Ex: Raw Wolf Meat - Small amount of health restored.Through all this, the game is great! It runs well on my fairly bad laptop, it has a good and stable server lineup,the overall feel is more entertaining than most survival games out there. I'd give it a solid 6.5 out of 10.If the bugs and AI were patched, I'd probably bump it to an 8. It's very good, hope to see some updatescome soon.

content:
Posted: July 6, 2015
Early Access Review
								I'm not going to lie to you: This is a difficult game. It's certainly harder than DayZ and unturned.  But if you've played those games your knowlage should translate.  Here's what makes this game stand out:You can die from so much more: In DayZ and Unturned, hunger  and players are your arch nemesis.  In this game you have hunger, cold, bears, wolfs, thirst, clothes, and even people that don't speak your language WILL kill you on sight.  This game is a harder DayZ with far fewer glitches (and a more bareable price tag).  So lets get down to my expiriences that will help you new players:This game is NOT friendly to new players, but at least you can get a hang of the controls.  The most helpful one is Z, if you can tell the people around you not to kill you then that's a perk.  Now, don't expect to run around for five minutes and find everything you need to survive.  It might've been that way in the prison but if you die you DO NOT return to the prison.  So if you have some high hopes of it being easy if you die you should head on over to DayZ or Unturned.  Next: If you don't want to be friends with someone you have an option: Kill them on the spot or rob them.  I prefer option two because it may save ammo.  Better yet: all guns you find won't have ammo, so if you simply point an unloaded gun at someone and threaten to shoot, they might never know.  Remember: once the robbery ends do not stick around. He might have friends.  If you feel like he didn't give you everything and you do have ammo: shoot him in the head.Next are animals: You have two threats in animals, they are wolfs and bears.  I've never seen a bear outside of the marshes so you shouldn't have too much panic.  The wolves are a different story, they are everywhere.  Good news is they're easy to kill, 2 axe swings or one shot will end them.  This doesn't mean they aren't dangerous however.Bears on the other hand I've only had one run in with, I can't say I liked it.  It jumped out at me in the marsh and scared the living♥♥♥♥♥♥out of me.  DO NOT FIGHT A BEAR.Next is food:  Food is a necessity, and so is water.  Find them and charish them.  Some food will require a can opener so be on the lookout for them.Cloths are vital.  If nothing previously listed kills you, this will.  Unlike Unturned or DayZ, you aren't in a habitable inviornment.  The enviornment of this game is norther Siberia.  If you aren't dressed right you will not survive.  You spawn in a pair of weird jeans (which I'm pretty sure have a swastica on the right leg) and some♥♥♥♥♥♥sneakers.  If you find a shirt put that♥♥♥♥♥♥on, you WILL freeze.  Players: TRUST NOBODY!  If you have friends, trust them but not too much.  They CAN and WILL turn on you eventually.  TO THE DEVS:  This is an amazing game but it needs some work:  I'd recommend slowing down the rate that you freeze to death and making more weapons.  Better yet: Let us be able to punch.Hope this helps you new playersEDIT:  You're going to want some music, I recommend anything by A7X if you like rock, Sabaton if you like metal, D12 Eminem Tupac or Kanye West if you like rap, Fallout boy if you like pop.EDIT 2:  I've since noticed that there aren't a lot of trolls, but when you find one they are very clever.  Always carry an axe with you so that someone doesn't block your exit with a massive wood wall.

content:
Posted: April 15
Early Access Review
								This is the first time I have reviewed a game, and that is because I believe in this game's potential so much.  I love survival games, and was pleasantly surprised by some of the aspects of the game.  I do not want to see this game fade into obsurity, which is why I write this in the hopes that someone with more influence than me can make this game more amazing.   First, what I loved.  The environment is nice to look at and does its job of making me feel like I'm stranded in the Siberian wilderness, scavenging long abandoned homes and buildings to survive.  Encounters with other players are- naturally-  cautious and untrustworthy, but how else would you react in a world where most of the population is dead?  NExt, the act of opening each individual drawer, locker, wardrobe and cabinet while scavenging for supplies goes a long way in immersing the player into the world- no menus or search timers.  The firearms are appropriately challenging to find (although sometimes you can find too much, for better or worse) and the realistic acts of loading the bullets you scavenge into magazines and being able to unload both gun and magazine is something I never knew I wanted in a survival game until I had it.  The crumbled buildings and abandoned structures are great for creating that lonely atmosphere that I love in a survival game. Food and drink are also tough to find(it is random, after all), but you won't always find mountains of food after the apocalypse (also, you need a can opener, screwdriver, or scissors to open canned food, which is a nice touch).These were only a few of the things that sparked my interest in this game, and I strongly encourage you to play it, and see what grabs your attention.  Now, let's move onto what I did not like, and some of the ways I think they could be fixed.  Please note that none of the following examples are NOT deal-breakers and are simply things that, if changed even slightly, can vastly improve the already immersive experience of this game.  First, temperature management; spawning in nothing but your underwear in the cold Russian expanse is lethal, but only having two ways to raise your temperature (a campfire and beer) and RNG making their discovery unpredictable is a great way to end up with stacks of frozen corpses.  I believe this can be fixed by making your core temp. decrease at a slower rate and having any clothing you are wearing protect you from the cold (that should be self-explanatory, right?)Next, wolves;  Yes, this is Siberia.  Yes, wolves are natural predators that will hunt you down relentlessly.  No, I do not enjoy being ripped apart by them immediately upon beginning my harrowing tale of survival.  You can easily fend them off with firearms and melee weapons, but until you get your hands on one, there's nothing to do except run.  This makes it difficult to scavenge for a weapon once a wolf has your scent, and the best strategy I found for dealing with them unarmed is to exit back to the menu and load back in hoping that they are gone.  Obviously, this is not a great way to play the game.  I recommend being able to attack unarmed and make the wolf retreat would be a great way to keep unequipped players alive long enough to find some basic gear.Multiplayer only servers.  Okay, this is more of a personal issue of mine and not any fault on the developers.  Unlike most people, I prefer to be the last man on Earth sometimes, I don't enjoy collecting backpacks full of gear and food only to be shot in the back of the head and realize I was basically doing someone else's grocery shopping.  I worked around this issue by always creating a new server when playing and then quitting out and starting another one when the number of players exceeded 4.  I would just like to get by and die on my terms, I hear wolves make great companions.Finally, and probably most basically, there's no settings or options menu.  Either I'm way more stupid than I think I am, or there is no way to change the settings of the game.  This is simple stuff here.So there... my first game review.  I love the way this game plays and feels.  The little things play a big part in making the game feel more real, and as I stated above, the problems are NOT deal-breakers, at least for me.  I think anyone on the fence about this game should give it a chance.  And if anyone with the ability to influence this game in any way reads this, then that's even better.Now if you'll excuse me, I'm going to running around shootingmy M1911 at the wolves in my underwear.TL;DR- More methods of warmth, need to punch wolves, gimme dem settings.

								This game has a lot of potential. But needs a lot of work and love. But I think it's worth the money, because it's a fun game. Yes it has some drawback,but don't forget, it's an alpha version. Recomended for all fans of postapocalyptic survival genre.For newcomers it can be hard,especially solo players, because of other players who hunt you,but be honest guys,in real postapocalyptic life,people are merciles :) Who whatched Revolution or The walking dead, 12 monkeys  series will understand :)The are couple problems and issues with this game,but I think developers will add them in the nearest future:-would be nice to see nicknames,add to friendlist on steam when meet somebody-give a handicap to new players or separate experienced from them who have a decent inventory(guns with bullets in particular)-add a tab,where you can see all the players in server and show stats ( for example how much hours in real time player stayed alive)Despite that,I recommend playing this with a friend or friends, it's hilarious :)

content:
Posted: June 4, 2015
Early Access Review
								This was my experience with this game. I was all suited up with clothing to brace the cold and weapons to defend myself. I had a good bit of food, and I was just surviving, ya dig? But that wasn't the highlight of my time. At one point, I met another player with an awfully peculiar voice, kinda creaky and high. I don't remember our exchange, but I only remember using this text-to-speech app to speak through my iPod. Anyways, we went our own ways and I hadn't seen the guy for about ten minutes. I ended up at that large house by the side of a road, not too far from a boat at the bottom of a hill, and I entered the house. Suddenly, I hear a familiar, gritty voice that says, "Hey, I'm stuck in the wall!" I look for this guy, and I can't find him, and he's urging me to check the closet, so I do, and there's nothing there. The guy keeps saying he's stuck in the wall, and he's just kinda tittering to himself and I get all anxious and whatnot. After awhile, he stops speaking and I just sorta sit there, all creeped out because this guy was watching me from inside a wall. Asides from that, this is a really good game if you're not dealing with Russian jerks or guys that ask to team up and then start bashing you with a hammer.

content:
Posted: July 26, 2015
Early Access Review
								its a very developed game for the early alpha phase and, even though it is more developed than dayz, there are things to be worked on. dayz has a lot of thought put into so before you start judging dayz for being further behind just know that there are things that dayz elaborates on that this game doesn't. first off you cant bleed to death in this game and in dayz you can. survival post apocalypse now has way more vehicles than the standalone, however the standalone has put more work into their vehicles. lastly dayz has a sickness meter and a much larger map with dynamic item spawns (the helicopter crash sites dont always spawn in the same place and guns and items dont always spawn in the same area ). Also dayz in my opinion has less hackers and a better way of dealing with them than survival post apocalypse now. I recommend both dayz and survival post apocalypse now. If you want a ultra realistic zombie apocalypse, go with dayz, if you want a survival game that is easy than dayz but still challenging go with survival post apocalypse now.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 6, 2015
Early Access Review
								Where to start. The reviews are mainly all great, and with good reason. Its a good game, especially for being $6. You can actually look down, and see your legs. One of the few games in which the player is allowed a lower body outside the inventoy page. The water physics are not the best, but optimal for the price, and even better than some other games. I'll just run down a list, or my review will just go on and on. Pros-Lower body, ohmygod, I have legs.-Decent water physics, for such a cheap price. -The inventory, despite being small, is realistic. People can only carry so much. -Everyone starts out the same way, which is good and bad, but good, because everyone has the chance to get a little stocked up before actually having to deal with the world's issues, and not have to worry about players having already looted the area.-Torches' flames go out when you are not holding them, and must be relit. Why is that a con? Its not good, but realistic, and thats the goal. Survival. I want to realize that I have to conserve fuel.-Stats. It doesn't give you bars, or percentages, you just have words, and your character will occasionally say something. I was dehydrated, so when I went into inventory, it said I was dehydrated, so I cracked open some sardines and reduced hunger and thirst, which brings me to my next pro.-Some items can reduce two things, such as sardines dropping thirst and hunger. Super handy. -Animals. I'm not sure what other games has animals, I know 7 days only has the messed up dogs and hornets, but this one has wolves. And bears. Glory to Mother Russia, right?Cons-No trust. Duh. If you play solo, you will die often unless you get lucky, run into almost noone, stumble upon some great loot.-Lack of water. Can I just eat snow? All I had were sardines. Nearly died before figuring out I could eat sardines to reduce thirst.-Climbing ladders looks so bad. I thought people had like a grappling hook, and were scaling up a tower, but no, they were just kind of floating up a ladder, no limbs touching, weapon drawn. -No day time? I'm not sure if I had to play longer, but there seemed to be no sun at all. Just darkness, and rain. -I'm really not sure if this is just me, but staying warm has been an issue. I've had my torch out, I have a sweater on, I stayed in doors, and still had temp drop. Curious if you need specifically a camp fire to warm up, or what. I really can't recall anything outside that, but that is what I think of the game. Is it worth $6? Absolutely. Especially if you can convince some people to play with you. I really hope this game keeps going and doesn't get discarded like most. 8.5/10

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 10, 2015
Early Access Review
								First thing I would like to say is that I love this game. I love the concept, I love the variety of weapons and items at the momen. For an early access game it has quite a lot of potential.Pros:Huge variety of weaponsQuite a big world Nice calming/misleadingly calm sceneryGood for lower spec computers (for now)Fitting musicVery nice price at £4.79Cons:For some reason dogs can walk through walls or no-clip through walls which can get annoyingDogs stop moving but keep on animating, as if they were attacking you or someone if you're not on the same level as themThe edge of the world is a clear invisible wall instead of a mountain or buildings.Floating object such as trees and buildings. (which is a common glitch with this sort of game in this state so I understand why those sort of graphical glitches in a survival game such as this)No climbing animation so if you look at someone climbing a ladder they'll just slide up/down the ladder.Can't find supplies most of the time resulting in starvation, dehydration or freezing to death.The tutorial ain't easy to follow.Things I would like to see in this game:A single player mode so you don't have to worry about being killed by some random person.A more detailed main menu.The ability to change FOV (field of view) and mouse sensitivity.A sort of creative mode or sandbox mode so you can test out equipment or vehicles.But overall I really enjoy playing this game and I think it has a lot of potential.I would rate this game 7/10 for the moment, but to be fair this game is too early in production to judge at the moment.P.S I know I have only played around 2 hours of this, but I wanted to make a review because I disagree with all the people who don't recommend this game because of a few errors/glitches.

content:
Posted: April 19, 2015
Early Access Review
								I saw someone playing this game, and after a short while became interested in purchasing it. For the price, it's worth trying it out, even on a lower end PC, which is amazing. This is a survival game where you find items, combine them, and (if you're smart) survive the harsh elements while dealing with people who will either help you, or kill you where you stand. It can be a bit tough at first, but once you get to know what to do, you'll become cautious and acquire items to survive! As long as the minor issues are patched, and some different things (items, inventory layout etc.) are implemented, this can become a great release for the price! Keep up with the discussions, provide your feedback on issues, and hopefully the devs can help us out! I will definitely come back to this game and play it, and am excited to see what new features will come of this great little survival map in the near future! Trust me, it's bigger than it looks! ;)

								The game is cheap only $5 but despite that its just a bunch of spawn, loot a nearby house, find almost no loot thats worth taking then out jumps another player that proceeds to bash your skull in with a bat... watch him teabag your corpse for the next 55 seconds then respawn and repeat....The game has horrible hit boxes, it takes ages to find a gun then the magazine then the bullets for it, even if you find a gun and ammo chances are you wont survive the gun fight and if that doesnt kill you the cold weather will...Only way to restore health I have seen is vitamin bottles i randomly found in cupboards...Even if I survive my characters body tempature never stops dropping even if hes wearing some kind of top and pants and hat...Never live long enough to find a lighter or gasoline and try making a camp fire to warm up and even if i did it would be a beacon for all other players to come bash my head in and teabag me while taking my stuff...At least the game runs well on low end computers thats a plus

content:
Posted: April 30, 2015
Early Access Review
								I made a review about this game awhile back and reccomended it. After a great deal of time after playing this, i have a huge change of heart. THIS GAME IS NOT WORTH 5$!! its worth .99cents at most....The game would be great if more poeple who talked and used their mics played it.It's Always shoot first, talk later, if you see a guy run or just KOS, they don't wanna talk or be friends, most don't even speak english.Your character dies too fast. it is impossible to get in a good 2 hours of gameplay without dying of thirst, hunger, or the worst of all, the cold weather. You can't find  resources fast enough to keep your character healthy. you starve and dehydrate too quickly before you can even find food and water. The freezing to death thing is annoying too. I had a character with thick jacket and a balaclava and i still froze to death!There is no tutorials for building items as well. The ways that the designers can make this game better.1.) Get more english speaking players that are active using the mic2.) Make it so you don't starve, dehydrate, or freeze to death as fast.3.) Put more Loot or supplies, or have them respawn faster in buildings.4.)Customizable character would be great too.5.) please nerf the damage that dogs do, or give more health to characters.If these changes are made i will make a recommended review again.

content:
Posted: May 26, 2015
Early Access Review
								DO NOT BUY THIS.As a fan of DayZ and other survival simulators, this is honestly the worst i've played. Shockingly, I'd happily play the abomination known as infestation survivor stories (WarZ) over this. Even though this is labelled as 'Early Access' it is not in a state to be released to the public. Some of my frustrations being:- Controls can't be edited in game- The ESC key returns you to the main menu- The inventory system is clunky and makes no sense- God awful generic jumping sound- Constant ambient sounds from wildlife on loop (owls hooting etc!)- Combat not fluid at all. Other players and wildlife sliding around.Some may ask why the hell I even bothered buying this. Well the truth is that I was really hoping to have a decent DayZ alternative to play. After reading the store page, which painted an optimistic picture, and reading the majority of positive reviews, it seemed easy enough to part with low price point of a few quid. However, it's the same rubbish that we've all seen before. A game made on an ok engine which has a few standard features that you see in all DayZ clones and then put to market. I will not be making this mistake again!

								So yes, this game is only $5 and I'd like to think that it has a lot of potential. But as of where the game stands right now, I can't recommend playing it. You're constantly getting killed before you can aquire any decent loot (either by players or wolves, since there is no melee attack). There doesn't seem to be enough loot for the amount of players on the server. Everytime you walk into a building there is more than likely another player in there, recently has been there, or walks in and kills you while you're in there. Even though I don't recommend it right now, I'd like to think, that over time, it will get much better.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 22, 2015
Early Access Review
								First of all. I will try to be fair here in the perspective as both a gamer and a fellow developer. This is not a flame review nor a you guys suck review. It is more like some friendly critics that I hope you guys would notice in a good and friendly way. And take into consideration when you keep on developing on the game.Gamer :  I would not recommend this to anyone in its current state. Item management is clumsy, Wildlife is clitchy as ♥♥♥♥. Sound and GFX (Even on Fantastic) gives you a migrane after a few minutes. Game seems way to small, i mean the few mins I have spent there it seems like i went from 1 invisible wall to another. Would not recommend even if it was free to play, and I dont understand why people would play this, when Dayz. Rust, Ark etc. is on steam.Developer. As a "open world" survival game 40 km2 is pretty small. Ones you are ingame it doesnt feel like 40 km2 at all though. it feels a lot smaller. Even though you announced that the game have a "Giant world with ability to keep up to 40 people on 1 server" As a comparrison DayZ chernarus (Mod) with 40 players felt small and that is 225 km2.You currently announce "Our game is almost in a finished state" Current state of the game in a "normal" roadmap is alpha state. The whole world need a redesign. roads overlapping each other in weird places, trees halfway inside buildings/floawing 5-10 cm over the ground. Props/assets needs a overhaul. wildlife ai, controls, UI and Hud needs a tweak, it looks like something that got rushed into greenlight.It might have been. I cant say for sure. I can see the whole idea with releasing a "New" survival game, and with the right angle you would be able to do that with success, no doubt about it. Kudos for the rain effect on the HUD. That is pretty neat though. And try and keep your facebook site up to date with the steam info. And avoid buying likes (Not sure if that is the case but the facebook meta on you page is extremely low considering there is 12k likes.)- Low Meta is bad for business, and fewer automatic adds posted in the "Sponsored" tab in facebook.This is the info on Facebook. - Awesome 3D graphics.(When saying Awesome 3D graphics, I think back when I saw Farcry for the first time, and I was like OMFG it is pretty, But in reality the current graphics, on fantastic makes the game look like a poor mans Arma 1 mod.)- Game world of 7 km2. (feels right when I played)Overall I would say good job in selling 3200+ copies. thats around 20k Euro :) Still show that there is a market for this type of games even though it seems rushed. Join "Indie Game Promo/Indie Game Developer & GameDev Beginners" on facebook. That have helpded me a lot regarding promotions, roadmaps, changes that needs to be considered before greenlighting a game. Or you can add me and I will gladly help out with what ever I can. promotions, marketing tips etc. anything!. I wont charge a dime. I will stick around and give this game another try, in the future. Cause I am a sucker for Post Apocalyptic survival games :DBest of luck and I hope to see this game develope to something awesome.

content:
Posted: December 22, 2015
Early Access Review
								     I wanted to love this game; but there is a reason I only have 0.2 hrs on record. I have a fairly decent gaming computer. I can run skyrim at max settings with no issues at 65 FPS and the fans barly have to move to keep the computer cool. This game is an enigma of programming a bugs. I first played it at my sisters house for an hour, her computer has similar specs, and this game was crashing, FPS was all over the place, and items, vehicels, and fun are no where to be found.      I love the idea of the game. It has a great base that needs no further explaining other than " Its Russia, it fell, its everyman for himself, have fun". However the exucution was aweful. The devs simply gave up. The bugs won't be fixed. The gameplay won't be improved. People in their right mind won't play it. Don't waste five dollars. Hopefully someone else will take the game over and actualy do something with it. It has the potential to be a hit if they would at least try.

Early Access Review
								I want to love this game. I really do. It has so many things i love in a game. PVP, character customization to for starters. but there are so many glitches it makes it hard. I fully understand it's in the early stages but the lag and is unbearable at times. Spending an hour collecting gear only to be killed by something that is not in the room or missing a point blank shot to the head with a shotgun is beyond frustrating.With all the issues i keep finding myself going back to play a few rounds every week.  Whats with being able to build a house? Does anyone actually do that? Seems a silly feature for this game. The game would be better if they focused on speeding up the game instead.I give it a 5/10 but with a few tweaks it could be much harder. Give it a few months and I'll re evaluate the game but right now It's far from a finished product

content:
Posted: December 4, 2015
Early Access Review
								I got this game a few months ago for the first time. I then returned it, only having about an hour and a half in the game, only reason was to get DayZ (which did not work even in the slightest), I did not re-purchase for a couple of months due to other things I wanted until I realized... I really missed this game. Sure its not as polished as even DayZ (DayZ still does need work), but this is a damn good game. it was one of the first games I bought off of steam, and to this day is still one of the best. if you're looking for a fully finished game that is completely perfect, then....... well go look up....... oh wait thats right, no game is perfect. every game has its flaws, and this game's flaws are nowhere near game breaking. I will say though, that this game is best played with at least 1 friend, but is 110% worth the $5 it costs. it is very hard to find a game for $5 that is beter than this one, more so the "survival" genre. So even if you have to go and specially buy a steam card for this game, it is most definetly worth it. I can not stress enough that this game, is a good replacement for most-all survival games out there, excludeing zombie related  (only because i really like zombie survival games because of the "war on three fronts")

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 11, 2015
Early Access Review
								Most of the reviewers don't even have more than 2h of playtime. This game is simple but nearly everything works the way it was thought to. It's all about surviving. Surviving wild animals or human players doesn't matter. You also might watch out to not freeze to death!It's thrilling. Every time a new experience. You work hard and get rewarded "ok". It's post-apocalyptic Syberia what did you think?!Based on the Unity engine. graphics, models and animations look ok. I love the ambient sounds of the game but they are very repetetive, but still enjoyable. Lighting and light effects are pretty and at night it can get spooky.All features seem to be working except for the "cargo mission". When I first played this game I was surprised because of that. I was able to do everything my "post-apocalyptic surviving me" could think of. I'd say "It just works" but it doesn't for everything. It's early access. But thats ok.I can't recommend this game for it's current state. (Long time no update, hackers with cracked clients) BUT the devs claimed to be back and I really look forward to see what they will come up next with. At least set it on your wishlist if you don't want to risk anything.5€ is a fair price for everything that you get. It's a lot of exploring and finding out how everything works by yourself.Had a lot of fun with it. Will have a lot of fun with it.

content:
Posted: February 19
Early Access Review
								I'm 3 hours into this game, and its a pretty basic little survival game. To me it is well worth the 5 dollars. Basically abandoned but works just fine most of the time in its current state. Understand that this is a PvP game. Everyone (and I do mean EVERYONE) is trying to kill everyone else, that's the point, and that's the fun of it. Do not get attached to anything you find, you'll probably end up losing it to the next guy, before the someone else kills him, and the cycle continues. Kill, loot, repeat.When you finally gear up enough to get your first kill its going to feel amazing, and you might even find yourself on a roll killing a couple of people before you're offed yourself and become a loot-pinata. Servers are pretty unpopulated, but even if you're on a map with one other person you're going to run into them and one of you is going to kill the other unless you're both completely unarmed. In which case you both lucked out, now run away, loot the nearest building and hope to find a weapon before they do. You will struggle to find food, stay warm, and to have inventory space enough to fill your basic needs. Weapons are scarce, ammo is scarcer, and your best bet is a melee weapon and no flashlight (ie no noise, no spotligBut as you keep playing  you just might find yourself surviving longer and longer. To figure out the controls you can use the 'Help' selection on the start page for a list of keybindings. Theres basically no other in game instruction, and  It doesnt tell you that you use 1 + 2 to switch weapons, but thats how you do it. You can only carry 2 of them. Anyone complaining about the game being too hard is a acting like a pansy and has no business playing survival games.

								Horrible Horrible! Wouldnt be bad if they actually done a few simple things to make game worth a damn! For one and prolly the most ridiculous of all is the inventory storage lol it is pathetic you can only carry very few items! sure you may find a gun but oops no room for a small box of ammo?! or if you have that guess what your not gonna eat or drink cause theres no room to carry the crap! That is one of the biggest issues in the game. plus everytime you find a gun guess what..... yup no ammo EVER!other issue is the graphics are literally playstation 2 gfx! I mean yea game is early access and all and even cheap but the inventory slots are what really makes me bitter. to enjoy a game you have to be able to actually get the things that are in the game that are supposed to make a game enjoyable.

Early Access Review
								It has an enjoyable gameplay but when you spawn right near the school (without any items) wolfs attack you immediately so you die before even arriving to the school. If you put guns, bullets and gasoline frequently in the map, I would be so happy. I love "the prison" because before entering the wildlife you can find "starter" items easily (ex. a lighter, a torch, a jacket... etc.) I recommend this game for the beginners who want to play survival games because this game teaches the basics of surviving.

Early Access Review
								Saw this game on steam about two weeks ago. With the price tag of 5.99 usd I figured I would give it a try even though I wasn't expection much from it. It started me off in a prison. After leaving there I traveled to two new locations. I starte looting stuff in draws, cabints, lockers, and such like other games do(dayz standalone). The game wasn't to bad until I started running into other players. Most had top tier gear and was just camping the noob area. So I died, died, died, and died so more. Couldn't leave the noob area and if I did, I would get killed by a player not long away. ---Pros----The loot system is good for a game of this price.Good amount of items/guns/tools.-When you go to other locations, it is it's own instance.---Cons----Players camping new player locations with top tier gear.-Hard to play alone on servers with more players on them.So would I suggest this game to anyone? If you like pvp survival games like dayz and just kos then this is for you. It's on 5.99 usd atm and if you don't like it after playing for less then 2 hours, you can ask for a refund like I did from steam. So I give the game a 4/10 for the looting/instance travel.

content:
Posted: January 27, 2016
Early Access Review
								I played 23 minutes of this, so take my review with a pinch of salt.The game is currently unplayable for computers less than one thousand pounds. I have a powerful computer and the frame rate was far too low to continue playing. If you are not like myself and most of the community and have an excrutiatingly expensive computer, by all means, I recommend it, but in it's current state, I don't recommend it at all. I did not die, I did not encounter anything, just twenty minutes of boring, slow, gameplay. I saw good reviews and thought 'This will be good!' and it wasn't. Developers: You really need to reduce the sizes of the map and do what you can to try to reduce the mass lag or nobody will play. Don't get me wrong, I like the game, it's a good idea and brilliant design of the maps and things, but there are far too many small glitches and bugs. There are also things like super slow frame rate, I was going at a rate of 5fps on a server with two people. It's ridiculous, my computer is powerful, so I was like: wtf?I do not recommend this game in the current state it is, but buy if you want to. I only played 23 minutes so don't take my review seriously, but that was my experience before it was too laggy and I quit.Please update the game with improvements. Email me at winnerasyougo@gmail.com if you wish to ask for what bugs and glitches are in the game.  I code and do designing, I can help with the development of the game, if you wish for my help, I am willing to give up my time for it. But for now, I'm refunding it, I'll rebuy it at a later date, but honestly, it really does need fixing.

content:
Posted: May 31, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game has a lot of potential to be one of the best survival games in contemporary market. Although it's still in alfa, but you can find tons of different loot (weapons, clothes, food etc) and make harsh environment more friendly. But the main reason is to survive trough getting constantly : thirsty, hungry and especially cold. You have to battle all the time to be sure to keep those 3 stats ant None and 36.6 value. Second if hunger or cold won't kill you, angry russians will (and a ton fo wolves and couple bears :D). PVP in this game is really realistic and encourages players to communicate with each other to overcome together every obstacle you meet in this game.But as for now this game has quite a lot of bugs :Random teleportation through the map, or even to another serverYou can't (yet) destroy other players wood house, they exploit it to block entrance to looting areas (houses and etc)Most importantly HACKERS - they can even ban you via spectator console and you will see the infamous "cat in the jar" rather than actually play the game. Second in starting areas alot of people are using AR's or M4A1's with unlimited ammo or other sort of advantage. These things seriously impact the overall performance of the game... Hope Devs will fix these things..But overall - Would recommend this game 11/10 cause of angry russians and harsh environment

content:
Posted: February 10
Early Access Review
								Got this game with my friend for a little survival fun. But is that what I got... You start off in a prison which looks like a scene from a horror movie so much so actually I went backed to the steam page to see if it was a horror game. Once out of the prison you are spawned onto a map. A map in which tbh is quite boring. With annoying dogs and a boring environment that is quite lacking graphically. But I would be able to forget all that if it wasn't for the loot. Loot is so incredibly hard to find and what little you do find isn't usually helpful. But it gets "better" me and my friend actually manage to find a gay, my friend walks up and says hi the gay turns to us screams through his mic in a heavy Russian accent "GIVE ME YOUR MEAT" saying I had no meat I figured he meant the meat off my bones (you can eat people you've killed) he then process to chance us with a shot gun for 15 minutes.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 11, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game gets unnecessary flak for certain things. Sure, the game isn't necessarily graphically beautiful, but most of the mechanics are solid, if a little bit rough around the edges. If it were Day-z's cousin, it'd be the cool cousin with the mullet and questionable tattoo. It's more casual, and in my opinion, more charming. It has a STALKER feel, which is something I really liked. However, all this aside, there doesn't seem to be very many players... Hopefullly that will change, hopefully people will pick it up and play.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 31, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game has a lot of potential to be one of the best survival games in contemporary market. Although it's still in alfa, but you can find tons of different loot (weapons, clothes, food etc) and make harsh environment more friendly. But the main reason is to survive trough getting constantly : thirsty, hungry and especially cold. You have to battle all the time to be sure to keep those 3 stats ant None and 36.6 value. Second if hunger or cold won't kill you, angry russians will (and a ton fo wolves and couple bears :D). PVP in this game is really realistic and encourages players to communicate with each other to overcome together every obstacle you meet in this game.But as for now this game has quite a lot of bugs :Random teleportation through the map, or even to another serverYou can't (yet) destroy other players wood house, they exploit it to block entrance to looting areas (houses and etc)Most importantly HACKERS - they can even ban you via spectator console and you will see the infamous "cat in the jar" rather than actually play the game. Second in starting areas alot of people are using AR's or M4A1's with unlimited ammo or other sort of advantage. These things seriously impact the overall performance of the game... Hope Devs will fix these things..But overall - Would recommend this game 11/10 cause of angry russians and harsh environment

								This Game is really, really awesome if you understand after knowing how to play it. Except it laggs on laptops which you have to turn down the graphic resolutions of the game but its ok. content:
Posted: February 6, 2016
Early Access Review
								Great game, the only thing that would put people off are the hackers and not many players. You need to implement some sort of tutorial and ranking system to keep players online. I really enjoy this game, I'v played about 28 hours. Otherwise its a very fun game.For the newbies that are wanting to join... here is a quick tutorial.Find Axe, chop down tree. Find hammer, click Q in your inventory will be wood from cutting the treenow hold your hammer while clicking the wood, you can now build. everything else is self explanitory really.To find out what gun you have click Q and look at the bottom of the screen, it will tell you what bullet its takes. Make a fire, wood + gasoline + Lighter. Exploring is probably the most fun. It is a challenging game and takes patience.

Early Access Review
								Survival: Postapocalypse Now, is STALKER, Mixed with DayZ. It has huge potential, and even now it is a really fun game to play with friends. If it keeps getting updated, then this game could be one of the top selling Survival games out there! :)

Anyway..for the price try it out, i was unsure to and at this point i dont regret my purchase. Hope you enjoy :)

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 19, 2015
Early Access Review
								ABANDONED: DISREGARD MY POSITIVE OPINIONAlthough it feels like it's very buggy and many things don't make sense in this game, it's still the most fun I've had in a survival game ever that isn't the DayZ mod. It's offered for a very cheap price and the developers update often and listen to the community. There's no annoying glitchy zombies, instead there's wolves and bears, which although are also glitchy and buggy, they make the game more fun and less silly.The gameplay is just amazing and if it weren't for the fact that the map ends at one point, I could be playing this forever. It's great for cooperative gameplay and survival is difficult, this game does the survival aspect right. It isn't just gather food, find a weapon and vehicle and then go kill a bunch of people, you also need to check your temperature, water and food is relatively scarce and medical supplies don't magically fill you to 100% health. You can get killed in just a few shots and if you get shot at, it will be difficult to fire back.There's so many different things that can kill you in this game, and it's amazing, even at this state. 8/10

content:
Posted: October 12, 2015
Early Access Review
								Looking for a cheap DayZ clone that'll run fine on your crappy PC? Look no further! This is a reasonably competent take on the zombie survival trend from a small-time development team out of Russia. It is Early Access, so you can expect some bugs and a lack of polish. Huge map but it is not seamless. When you cross into a new area the screen will go black for a few seconds while it loads the new area... The game uses a crap ton of RAM all at once to load up that new section. If you're using a 32bit OS, then it's probly gonna crash due to the 2gb limit for applications. I was able to fix the crash using this http://steamcommunity.com/app/351290/discussions/0/598198356186535393/

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 29, 2015
Early Access Review
								Not really a game i would let my friends play... yet.Its got potential and i can see where they are trying to go with this but being killed as soon as you enter a game is not very fun. my game play went like this basically:Start as a noob character, whats that i hear a faint noise of a voice from somone else i pay with? What no way to chat with them because there is no text to chat?( to avoid spammers probably)Got a mic but can barely hear anyone else( probably my settings but idk which) walk a few yards find the first house looks like a fishing shack. Oh no there is two russians who dont speak a lick of english killing noobs, with guns. Respawn! ( 60 seconds to wait for a respawn and watch the guy that killed me t-bag my body. Didnt even know t-bagging was still trending since COD ghost)Found a nice chucrch already looted :/ too bad but found a hat though so cool. * Killed by a random person with a baseball bat from behind* Oh and another 60 seconds to wait for a respawn and watch the guy kill 2 more noobs at the church and loot all their stuff. Ohwell i guess there is people who pry on noobs but they make gameplay very... not fun. my fnal life before i decided to get off at 4:00am i spawned at the beginning again with nothing but a bat. I started off walking to the fishing shack, nice to know the russians got bored and left. I immidiatly took off across the river this time( thats right you can swim. rock on) found another bigger church(heard some footsteps inside) Snuck around but too bad even crouched footsteps can be heard like stomping. found all kinds of gear, a nice orange hat, a nice white sweater( good for the cold cause damn its cold) found some water and some food and a can opener woot!. Posted up here for the night :PAnd thats all for now might play some more later but the constant... lone wolfing gets boring. If you play this game be sure you play with a friend you know or somone you trust cause being on your own is really no fun.

content:
Posted: April 22, 2015
Early Access Review
								Start off Naked and afriad (and cold).  First building I see, I run into.  Find a nice sweater and an axe.  Score!   Suddenly some a-hole with tattoos all over his body comes in with a baseball bat.  He clobbers me one, but I run away.   Note to self...stay away from people with weapons.  I start to explore, soon finding what looks like it used to be a military outpost.  Find some weapons and ammo.  Cool!  Now I'm fully clothed and have a shotgun with lots of ammo.   Explore some more.  Find a crashed airplane.  Nothing really exciting in it, but there is a bunker right underneath.  I go in.  Looks like nobodys been here before.  There is an elevator, but It wont work.  I find a generator, but I have no fuel.  Ok..time to look for some fuel.  Search everywhere for miles and miles...finally find 3 yellow containers of gas.  I start running back to where the bunker was, but I'm lost now and its raining and I'm getting waaay too cold.  I find an old church.  I light a fire to get warm, but outside the window I see people running around.  Oh crap.  Then i see someone in the church.  I point my shotgun at him because he's holding an axe so he's obviously there to hurt me.  He asks if im friendly.  I dont trust him so I say nothing and just continue to point my gun at him.  Next thing I know I look over my shoulder behind me and there are 2 guys, both with axes, right on top of me.  I run and start shooting them because obviously if they were friendly, they wouldnt have weapons in their hands!  I take out all 3 of them, finish getting warm, and keep going on my journey.  As I leave the church, I see they were building a house.   Oh no!  What have I done?   They probably just wanted advice on how to build their little cabin.   Well, whats done is done.Back to my journey i find a map, get my bearings and head straight for the bunker avoiding any houses and stray dogs, but Im getting cold again, so I head to a house.  I see light and someone moving.  I'm careful and see this guy with a very powerful rifle going through some drawers.  He is fully geared and looks like someone I don't want to mess with.  He doesnt see me, but it wont be long before he does.  I pull out a pistol and start firing.  First shot, hes just like WTF?  I shoot again and he spots me, he looks like hes about to run, but the 3rd shot took him down.  I run in to check the house if there is anyone else there i need to kill.  I see 2 dead bodies with loot everywhere.  I grab all the guns/ammo/food/fuel I can use their fire to get warm and run.   At least this time I know I got an unfriendly.   I get to the bunker, ready to start up the generator...DOH...wrong type of fuel.  Now I have to go back out there into the dangerous unknown and hope I dont get shot.10/10Day 2I search long and hard and finally find some gas for the generator, but I walked far to get it.  Decided to look around and see if I couldnt find some more supplies.  I'm in luck, I find a car battery.  Maybe I can get in one of the many cars I've seen and drive back to the generator.  I'm still scouting around and hit the jackpot.  I find medicines, a very very large backpack, tons of ammo, weapons, ect.  I'm fully geared and ready to get in a car and drive myself back.  As I'm walking to a car, I hear a couple dogs bark.  No problem, I'm good at running past them.  But dead ahead I see several dogs coming at me.  I check to the side and they are coming at me from that direction.  No less than 8 dogs.  I drop my axe and pull out my pistol and kill 2 dogs and then my pistol clicks.  OH NO!  I forgot to reload with my last encounter.  I quickly try to reload as the dogs are on top of me.  I start firing, but there were too many of them and I couldnt reload fast enough.  They got me.

content:
Posted: October 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								My first playthough of this game:I wake up in a prison and walk around grabbing a bunch of empty weapon magazines that I don't know how to load with bullets and an axeI wander into a trainyard and suddenly my character becomes tattooed and looks like an overall badassI find some freshly spawned person and start visciously stabbing him behind his back. He turns around slowly, unsure of what was happening as if he was a newborn. He falls on the ground and drops no itemsI wander around the trainyard some more and I see a wolf approaching me, (which sounds oddly like a puppy rather than a wolf) I kill it with my axe and it drops a hunk of raw meatEventually I begin to get hungry, and I choose to eat the raw meat as there is nothing else around. My ears are suddenly assaulted with this extremely loud stock chomping sound effect, and then I am fullI wander around the trainyard even more, still finding nothing. Then I hear my character say "my mouth is dry, I need something to drink". Unfortunately there is no source of water anywhere nearby, so I keep movingMy character is now literally saying "I'm thirsty" "My mouth is dry" and "Damn I really need something to drink" about every 2 secondsI try and look for water, but I find none, and now my character begins including the phrase "Damn I'm hungry" into his continuous 2 second mantra of complaining that he is thirstyAbout 5 minutes later I find a building in another town and I run in looking for something to make my character shut the ♥♥♥♥ upI hear talking and a flashlight and out of pure desperation run to it hoping to kill him and take his food and waterI encounter a group of 3 fully geared men and they gun me down. For a brief moment, somewhere in the back of my mind, I thank themBut my misery does not end with my death, as my character's phrases "Damn I need something to eat" and "Damn I'm thirsty" glitch out and begin repeating over and over at the same time, overlapping and sounding like the voices of some circle of hellI close the game and walk away from my computer screen.It's a pretty good game

content:
Posted: January 22, 2016
Early Access Review
								I have to start out by saying i think this game has some potential to be a good game. I played for 3 hours and really want to like it. It is different. I got frustrated by having absolutely no instructions listed anywhere and no way to what keys did what. It literally took me until the third hour to learn how to load a gun. I think it is because I didn't have the right ammo for any of the guns that i found. I eventually found a shotgun and found some shells. and reload was "R". I thought i had the right shells for the gun I was carrying but the caliber was not listed on the gun and the caliber listed with the bullets and clips were listed differently than I am used to. so it was hard to identify when I had the right ammo for the pistol I had. Also when you find thing you cannot carry enough items. this was very frustraing. Water is hard to find so I hoarded that....food was fairly simple to find but sometimes I would have to carry a can opener which I didn't want to carry due to inventory space. You can die of starvation, hunger and hypothermia. You start off with 6 inventory slots If you find water then definitely take it. 1 slot used. Find another water....well definitely take that. 2 slots used. Find food......alright found a can......3 slots. Oh.....need a can opener....found one 4 slots used........I am getting cold. I need an axe.....well that is a weapon so it doesn't count in my slots...that's good so I chop a tree and got a piece of wood 5 slots but now I need a lighter and a can fuel to ingnite the wood. That's 7 slots!. I did eventually find a back pack which expanded to up to 12 slots but I write that out to describe the frustration I felt when I knew I was getting h8ungry and thirsty fast and needing tyo hoard things but having to drop them just to continue on. Then thinking I can just go back for them to find that it respawned withing minutes of me finding them. DANG! it's not there now I am screwed.....now I die......and I start over with nothing. I will try it again later and hope I will change my mind to give it a thumbs up. I certainly don't think I wasted my $5 because it is a really neat concept. I mostly wanted to offer feedback to the developers who seem to really be invested in making it a good game. IMHO......list some instructions like the basic key commands....it would have helped me out quite a bit.

content:
Posted: November 13, 2015
Early Access Review
								Started out in a prison, thought "huh this is interesting" lockpicked my way out of my cell, exited through the sewer and ended up in a trainyard. Russian prison sewers end up in a trainyards? That seems like a bit of an oversight. I had not head or appendages to speak of, and i remember reading in a survival handbook that people can't see you when you are naked, so i did the only logical thing and stripped as naked as i could. I heared gunshots in the distance and decided to investigate.  I found three guys standing over a body, they were all speaking in Russian so i decided to practice some foreign diplomacy. I was halfway through apologizing in advance for my bad Russian, when one of them walked up to me and said "you have seen too much" and shot me in the head with a double barreled shotgun. I respawned in the same trainyard, got chased by screaming Russians, Americans, two wolves, and a bear for about two hours. I saw somebody commit murder suicide, three people die in a row because they thought a ladder was climbable (i think they were the Russians from before), a tractor used as a weapon of mass murder, countless cases of shotgun diplomacy, and a wooden skyscraper. This game is pretty amazing. It has awesome firefights, walkie-talkies, a better community than DayZ, Russians, and for the price of 5.99 USD or 5 Euros it can be yours. I honestly suggest this game to people who have 5.99 and nothing to do with it.
