number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 7, 2015
Early Access Review
								Survival: Postapocalypse Now is an early acces Alpha FPS survival game, it has no campaign but a funny, adventurous and sometimes exciting multiplayer-survaval game mode. Although it costs us a little, as far as I'm concerned, it is not too much for the content of the game. In addition to in-game features, sometimes players will have to face challenges from the environment itself and other players, prudence will be your key and best friend to survive with.In this game, you will find more developped materials, resources and weapons by moving further and further away, you can still stay where you were when you have spawned, but my suggestion will be to advance, get fully equipped and packed with enough food and other raw materials. In this game, you can even make a helicopter fly or driving cars and jeeps.I also strongly recommend you to play this game with friends, it will be really funny and interesting to play with more players than just alone. It will be much easier to survive since you find different materials in different places, for example: you might find an AK-47 on a table while your teamnate can see just a bottle of water on the same table. You will get more chance to find rare items and will find it easier to survive. You can also kill the players then grab their items, which is more easily than gather them slowly but surely.P.S: there are no zombies in this game, so if you get into a dark area you don't need to be afraid.^^Positive remarks+ multiplayer mode+ very interesting and funny to play with friends+ difficulty improved each time you go towards a new map+ challenging to survive with some enemy players+ wide range of weapons and resources+ only 2 kinds of animals will attack you: wolves(dogs?) and bears+ new ways to survive ( cooking )+ vehicles + dynamite+ quick updates from the GM+ different features and functions on clothesNegative remarks- sometimes severe bugs will occur (ex: you spawn on the sky and die by falling on the ground)- animals (that are offensive) spawn always at the same place, less challenging- only a few maps to discover- hackers- temperature issues for survival decreases a little bit too quickly- at first, players spawn in a prison and can die right away if you don't get out quickly enough, especially to beginners- weapon switching system is a bit strange

Early Access Review
								This game is awesome to play. The only downside with the new update is that you can't ever play by yourself. If I could recommend any improvements the following would be my recommendations. 1. searching for a specific server would be nice for playing with friends 2. creating servers was nice, you could play by yourself and didn't have to worry about other players 3. spawning in with nothing makes it very hard to survive from dogs. All in all I know this game is a work in progress and nothing is final yet, but playing with friends can be very hard to do and playing by yourself is even harder. Do I recommend this game? Yes, I for sure do. Like I said I know its a work in progress and I'm happy to play the game.

								For 5 bucks, it's a good buy. I've played about an hour with some friends, and if I never play again, I believe I got my monies worth. It seemed really easy to find both of my friends when starting. Not sure if this was luck, or there's only a few new user spawn points, but we all started just a few blocks from each other.The game is difficult to get started in, as food doesn't seem very bountiful and you starve fairly quickly. It's basically a poormans DayZ. Should you get it? Yes, though remember: It's only 5 bucks, and you get what you pay for.

content:
Posted: May 15, 2015
Early Access Review
								Don't buy at this stage unless its under $10.00 , whilst fun it feels unfinished and unbalanced, however given this is early build its understandable.Pros :- Mostly complete game- Weapons are as expected in real life ( no head shot no damage RNG BS ) - Controls are fairly easy to use - Somewhat fun Cons : - You start the game unarmed, and you don't know how to punch or kick- Due to the above advanced players will camp your spawn points, as its safer to kill you than other well setup players- Nothing is explained before starting the game - Very easy to die of thirst, except its not logical, see empty bottles lying around, can you refill it ? , nope, drink a plastic bottle of water and the bottle vanishes- My system is fine , but it could chug on some machines- Not sure if everyone has this but my game had missing options from start menuMy review could change out of early testing , but at this stage stay away unless your wanting to put up with a fair amount of spawn killing and no real objective other than " collect crap kill players "

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 15, 2015
Early Access Review
								One of the best survival games out there! If you're trying to decide whether to buy this game, let me tell you, it's definitely worth the $5. I also bought 2 copies for my friends and it's our new favorite game to play together. When we first logged on, I thought this game was going to be a waste of money, but then we began to understand the game better and we figured out that there's a lot more to this game than you think. We play it all the time now and we're still new players in it, but it's a good game.We were always stuck in the first area where we always spawned and couldn't figure out what to do next, but now I've memorized the areas and maps and we're moving up. There's a lot of stuff in this game, but I know you're wondering where the zombies are at...well, there are no zombies! But that's a good thing with this game. It makes it a better and more realistic game without zombies, and gives you more time to focus on not getting killed by other players or wolves!I really recommend this game and if you have the money, please buy it and support these great developers.

								This game sucks. It has no tutorial and just drops you into the game and expects you to try. I tried. All they give you to defend yourself at the start is a torch. A torch that as far as I can tell you cant relight after it extinguishes. But if you die, as you likely will, you have nothing. You cannot attack without a weapon, and you cannot craft anything. There are a few cars and such parked around, but none of them work. And when you die, you have no choice but to watch some other moron, likely the one that killed you, walk around for 60 seconds straight. Don't want to sit through that 60 seconds? Sucks for you. The only way to exit the game from the inside is through the invintory, which you cannot open when dead. DO NOT GIVE THESE PARISITES ONE MORE PENNEY!!!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 25, 2015
Early Access Review
								First of all: the "our game is almost in a finished state" in the discription is a LIE ... i would call it a superearly-ALPHABecause there are more CON´s than PRO´s i will start with the CON´s this time---CONS---> NOTHING is explained in this game ... absolutely nothing - this makes the first time of the game a pain in the A$$lovely if your character is freezing, you have a lighter, you have gasoline, you have wood, and you just cant find out how to make a fire to keep yourself warm. > "open world" here means a lot of smaller areas connected viá quick-travel points > weapon-system is annoying . you can carry (2?) weapons but put nothing (revolver or hammer for example) in your backpack. sometimes your weapon stays on the floor if you change it to another, sometimes it just disappears (so no switching back if you change your mind for some reason, yaay -.-)> voice-chat radius is a joke, you really have to stand next to the person you wanna talk to (not that useful if you wnt to find out if he is friendly)>  the community... again (like in the most survival games...) people kill just at sight, doesnt matter if you just spawned in your underwear and obviously not dangerous> the inventory-size makes no sense: you have 8 slots if you are running around in underwear ... you will be crying when you finally find a standard-backpack and see it just gives you 4(!?) new slots> items arent shared in teh world... what i mean: i see (for example) a can of beans in a shelf - my friend (standing next to me) cant see it but maybe has something totally differnt in the same location (or nothing). only option is to pick it up and drop it for him. well seems like a simple way to solve the problem, BUT: this means if you play in a team everyone has to search each house individual - gamebreaking in my opinion>  spectator mode when you die ... seriously?---PROS---> cheap> graphic is "ok"> you can open nearly every drawer and door to search for stuff > havent had any server issues so far> HAS the potential to become a good game someday

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 22, 2016
Early Access Review
								I wish there was a mixed button but there isn't soo...I started playin' survival back in 2015 with my best friend the game was available on facebook, you could buy kits that would vary from 0,20€  to 2€ wich is pretty much the same in dollars.The game was really fun, it was more focused on combat and pvp pretty much with no survival aspect, it had alot a hackers but they weren't a big threat. there were some bugs here and there but nothing special. And about the microtransactions, it was really easy to find weapons so the players that spent money in the game wouldn't have advantages. It's 2016, I have more than a 1000 hours in the game.Finnaly the steam version launched and we didn't really care.Soem onths later we decided to go to steam and see what's new about the steam version we looked at the community hub and there was a bunch of cool vehicles and etc, and we thought that the game was really cool so we decided to buy it.First day of playing the game, me and my friend took 1 hour and 30 minutes to find each other, then another hour goes by and we find one player who had a shotgun, we tried to communicate with him and he started shooting us, he missed all the shots and i shot him one time in the head i killed him, pretty use kill, i was already used to shooting in survival.So now i have 13hours of gameplay and i gotta say,the game has a LOT of potential but, right there's alot of bugs and gamebreaking problems, almost nobody playing and I  can understand why.So i recommend you to play the facebook version instead, you'll have alot more fun.If you have 5 bux to spare and want to support the devs it's your choice.I keep looking forward to this game, and i hope this review helps.

content:
Posted: October 7, 2015
Early Access Review
								Survival: Postapocalypse Now is an early acces Alpha FPS survival game, it has no campaign but a funny, adventurous and sometimes exciting multiplayer-survaval game mode. Although it costs us a little, as far as I'm concerned, it is not too much for the content of the game. In addition to in-game features, sometimes players will have to face challenges from the environment itself and other players, prudence will be your key and best friend to survive with.In this game, you will find more developped materials, resources and weapons by moving further and further away, you can still stay where you were when you have spawned, but my suggestion will be to advance, get fully equipped and packed with enough food and other raw materials. In this game, you can even make a helicopter fly or driving cars and jeeps.I also strongly recommend you to play this game with friends, it will be really funny and interesting to play with more players than just alone. It will be much easier to survive since you find different materials in different places, for example: you might find an AK-47 on a table while your teamnate can see just a bottle of water on the same table. You will get more chance to find rare items and will find it easier to survive. You can also kill the players then grab their items, which is more easily than gather them slowly but surely.P.S: there are no zombies in this game, so if you get into a dark area you don't need to be afraid.^^Positive remarks+ multiplayer mode+ very interesting and funny to play with friends+ difficulty improved each time you go towards a new map+ challenging to survive with some enemy players+ wide range of weapons and resources+ only 2 kinds of animals will attack you: wolves(dogs?) and bears+ new ways to survive ( cooking )+ vehicles + dynamite+ quick updates from the GM+ different features and functions on clothesNegative remarks- sometimes severe bugs will occur (ex: you spawn on the sky and die by falling on the ground)- animals (that are offensive) spawn always at the same place, less challenging- only a few maps to discover- hackers- temperature issues for survival decreases a little bit too quickly- at first, players spawn in a prison and can die right away if you don't get out quickly enough, especially to beginners- weapon switching system is a bit strange

								This game has good consistency behind it, however it is now abandoned by the developers, and will remain in it's state for a long time. I have attempted to give this game a chance to change, and the developers have had plenty of time to do it, but since this game is always going to remain in a broken state, I have been provoked to not recommend this game.  For example; the jumping physics in the game are absolute rubbish, forcing you to die, even if you jump from a little height.   However, do not take my word 100% for this game, you may really enjoy it, but I do recommend that you play with friends, it helps. Trust me.

content:
Posted: August 9, 2015
Early Access Review
								At this stage I would suggest avoiding.The graphics are medioocre at bet.The controls are clunky.The seems to be very little to do.You wake up in a cell, pickup a screwdriver and lighter, move to the door and its says "cannot open it!' "Cannot open it" "Cannot open it" . . . . . .. Then I restart the game and do exactly the same thing and this time he CAN open the door ??/Then you wander aimless around the prison until you find the tunnel that goes outside.  No real game play so far!Outside you wander around some more, maybe find a can opener or some other useless item, until a bear or wolf comes along and kills you.I've yet to find anything of significance such as a weapon . . . ..The game itself runs okay, I suppose, but the graphics and general controls are average at best at this stage.On the store page the developers state “Our game is almost in a finished state. . . . ."  I truly hate to think that that is the case.  This game seems barely in ALPHA stage....In a nut shell the basic problems with this game are:Poor graphics, both in models and rendering.Poor controls, mediocre responce time, very basic controls.Limited content.  A few areas of interenst but no real playability value in them.Poor performance all round. Very choppy at times, slow response, stuttering animations etc. (I run an i7 with 16 GB ram and an R9 graphics, with SSDs etc.)Hopefully it will improve with time but at this stage its boring, and not worth the time or money; AND is FAR from being "ALMOST IN A FINISHED STATE!"

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 26, 2015
Early Access Review
								EDIT: Unfortunately, as I thought, this game has floundered. Positive review changed to negative.Recommended at this price, but VERY early and unfinished. I'm not convinced the developer will support the game into a "finished" state; it may very well go the route of other Early Access survival games, and be interesting + full of potential but ultimately never achieve what it should've, and eventually be abandoned or have development slow to a crawl with tons of bugs a la The WarZ or a half-dozen other games in the genre. The developer stating:“Our game is almost in a finished state...“The game will stay in Early Access until we have a final polished version of it for PC, Mac and Linux. Probably a six months of polishing with the community feedback.”worries me the most. In my mind, there's no way that's achievable. If their plan is to push it out the door within 6 months, then the game will certainly have issues.With that said, it's fun and promising, and for $5.50 CAD, it's worth a shot.My first spawn/life:Within 30 seconds of spawning I ran into a British guy named Tim clearing out a couple buildings. I told him over voice chat that I had just spawned and was new to the game. He gave me a backpack and some other stuff, and asked if I wanted to group up. I was like sure, so off we went looting buildings and♥♥♥♥♥♥ I found a rifle, and Tim happened to have some ammo for it, so he gave it to me.Eventually he afks for a sec or something, but while he's gone I realize I'm critically dehydrated, so I leave him in search of water. About 5 minutes later quite some distance away from where I left him, I overheard two people talking - one of them was Tim, and the other some random guy. They had just run into each other, and while they were being cautious neither was KoSing. So I'm still desperate for water, so I take aim from some shrubbery at the random guy, and headshot him. Tim starts freaking out, cuz he doesn't realize it's me, until I tell him on voice coms. then we looted the guy's corpse, and I got the water I needed.So we went off again clearing buildings. I went into one, got shot once in the back as I stepped through a doorway, spun around and got 1 shot off, but then got hit again and died. Tim went in to investigate, and he swiftly got domed as well.Initial impressions:The game is still painfully early on, but it shows potential. On the Steam Early Access store page, they say they're aiming at full release within six months. This is absolutely not a reasonable goal, considering how glaring some of the issues are. The game needs a LOT of work and polish, but I'm having fun despite the issues.Some of the problems I ran into:The UI is♥♥♥♥♥♥ total crap. There's no in-game settings screen. You set your graphics options pre-launch ranging from Fastest to Fantastic, with no detailed options at all. No volume sliders or anything. I think you can rebind some keys out of game, but again not ingame, and as far as I can tell it's quite limited (no hold ADS or crouch, just toggle, etc.). The inventory system is unintuitive and filled with typos and Engrish (or whatever the Russian equivalent of that is). No way to change mouse sensitivity. That's a big one for me. No way to turn off headbob, which I really, really hate.It's kinda buggy sometimes. If your inventory is 1 spot from full and you try to pick up two items in quick succession, you pick up the first and instead of being unable to pick up the second, it just vanishes into the ether. I lost a couple guns this way. As far as I can tell, you can hold 3 weapons at a time, but you can only access 2 of them. Like, you literally can't swap to the third. You can't choose which two. You have to drop one of them to use the third. This might just be an issue with pistols, not sure yet.Engrish, lack of options, lack of accessibility. No user list to see who's currently in a server, only a total number count. No friends list or social options at all. When you're mildly thirsty, it says LowThristy (yes, that's thristy not thirsty).Confusing/unexplained items. Lots of items that combine with each other, but there's no indication of what combines with what or what an item actually does. For instance, radio/walkie talkie - initially had no battery. I found a battery and combined the two. Now the radio has a battery. Still not a clue how to use it or what its actual ingame function is. Lots of items that I had no idea wtf they were or what they did. There are different drinks/foods in the game, and they seem to have a varying amount of uses/amount of hunger/thirst replenished, but those numbers aren't indicated ingame. There are helmets and different types of clothing (and I think maybe armor too) but as far as I can tell they didn't say what they really did in terms of warmth or protection. Perhaps they're just cosmetic, but idk.Speaking of, anything "on" you and not in your bag (clothes, helmet, hat, guns, bat, axe, etc.) doesn't show up on your inventory to interact with. It shows up on a playermodel that's open when your inventory is, but as far as I can tell you can't actually change stuff - or maybe you can and the interface is so poor I just couldn't figure it out. For example, if you pick up a shirt you automatically put it on. afaik, you can't drop that shirt on the ground unless you pick up another shirt (which is again, automatically put on and your current one drops.)Unexplained game mechanics; I died of hypothermia. I had a lighter and gasoline on me, tried combining the two, couldn't figure out how to make a fire. Maybe I need wood or something as well, but I didn't find any of that. I didn't know what to look for. oh, and when I died - you get a 60 second respawn timer, and during that time you can't do anything. You can't open the menu to quit the game, even.Despite these types of gripes, I still had fun playing it. I've put a couple hours into it so far, and I'm definitely going to play more. I'm looking forward to some of the kinks getting sorted out. I know I've focused a lot more on the negative than the positive, but it really is quite entertaining. and at the pricepoint, even if it were completely terrible it wouldn't be a huge deal.As an Early Access game, I'm having fun with it knowing what it is, and I'm looking forward to the game being made better. At the pricepoint, with those things in mind, it's worth it. However, if this is approximately what the game launches as, with all the bugs and issues it currently has - then I'd say steer clear.

They had just run into each other, and while they were being cautious neither was KoSing. So I'm still desperate for water, so I take aim from some shrubbery at the random guy, and headshot him. Tim starts freaking out, cuz he doesn't realize it's me, until I tell him on voice coms. then we looted the guy's corpse, and I got the water I needed.So we went off again clearing buildings. I went into one, got shot once in the back as I stepped through a doorway, spun around and got 1 shot off, but then got hit again and died. Tim went in to investigate, and he swiftly got domed as well.Initial impressions:The game is still painfully early on, but it shows potential. On the Steam Early Access store page, they say they're aiming at full release within six months. This is absolutely not a reasonable goal, considering how glaring some of the issues are. The game needs a LOT of work and polish, but I'm having fun despite the issues.Some of the problems I ran into:The UI is♥♥♥♥♥♥ total crap. There's no in-game settings screen. You set your graphics options pre-launch ranging from Fastest to Fantastic, with no detailed options at all. No volume sliders or anything. I think you can rebind some keys out of game, but again not ingame, and as far as I can tell it's quite limited (no hold ADS or crouch, just toggle, etc.). The inventory system is unintuitive and filled with typos and Engrish (or whatever the Russian equivalent of that is). No way to change mouse sensitivity. That's a big one for me. No way to turn off headbob, which I really, really hate.It's kinda buggy sometimes. If your inventory is 1 spot from full and you try to pick up two items in quick succession, you pick up the first and instead of being unable to pick up the second, it just vanishes into the ether. I lost a couple guns this way. As far as I can tell, you can hold 3 weapons at a time, but you can only access 2 of them. Like, you literally can't swap to the third. You can't choose which two. You have to drop one of them to use the third. This might just be an issue with pistols, not sure yet.Engrish, lack of options, lack of accessibility. No user list to see who's currently in a server, only a total number count. No friends list or social options at all. When you're mildly thirsty, it says LowThristy (yes, that's thristy not thirsty).Confusing/unexplained items. Lots of items that combine with each other, but there's no indication of what combines with what or what an item actually does. For instance, radio/walkie talkie - initially had no battery. I found a battery and combined the two. Now the radio has a battery. Still not a clue how to use it or what its actual ingame function is. Lots of items that I had no idea wtf they were or what they did. There are different drinks/foods in the game, and they seem to have a varying amount of uses/amount of hunger/thirst replenished, but those numbers aren't indicated ingame. There are helmets and different types of clothing (and I think maybe armor too) but as far as I can tell they didn't say what they really did in terms of warmth or protection. Perhaps they're just cosmetic, but idk.Speaking of, anything "on" you and not in your bag (clothes, helmet, hat, guns, bat, axe, etc.) doesn't show up on your inventory to interact with. It shows up on a playermodel that's open when your inventory is, but as far as I can tell you can't actually change stuff - or maybe you can and the interface is so poor I just couldn't figure it out. For example, if you pick up a shirt you automatically put it on. afaik, you can't drop that shirt on the ground unless you pick up another shirt (which is again, automatically put on and your current one drops.)Unexplained game mechanics; I died of hypothermia. I had a lighter and gasoline on me, tried combining the two, couldn't figure out how to make a fire. Maybe I need wood or something as well, but I didn't find any of that. I didn't know what to look for. oh, and when I died - you get a 60 second respawn timer, and during that time you can't do anything. You can't open the menu to quit the game, even.Despite these types of gripes, I still had fun playing it. I've put a couple hours into it so far, and I'm definitely going to play more. I'm looking forward to some of the kinks getting sorted out. I know I've focused a lot more on the negative than the positive, but it really is quite entertaining. and at the pricepoint, even if it were completely terrible it wouldn't be a huge deal.As an Early Access game, I'm having fun with it knowing what it is, and I'm looking forward to the game being made better. At the pricepoint, with those things in mind, it's worth it. However, if this is approximately what the game launches as, with all the bugs and issues it currently has - then I'd say steer clear.
